description: John George Brown is a British-born American painter renowned for his heartwarming genre scenes, particularly those depicting street urchins in New York City. His work was widely popular with wealthy collectors and often reproduced as lithographs.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1907 seems to capture the moment when John George Brown, a seasoned artist with a growing reputation, was at the height of his career, showcasing his mastery of genre scenes and heartwarming depictions of New York's street life.
title: John George Brown
name: John George Brown

description: Abbott Handerson Thayer is a prominent American artist, naturalist, and teacher who is best known for his 'angel' paintings, his camouflage theories, and his book "Concealing-Coloration in the Animal Kingdom."
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1920 seems to capture the moment when Abbott Handerson Thayer, a man of both artistic vision and scientific curiosity,  stands at the crossroads of his artistic and scientific pursuits, his legacy poised to influence generations to come.
title: Abbott Handerson Thayer Self-Portrait
name: Abbott Handerson Thayer

description: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt is a 19th-century American author whose Flora's Dictionary popularized the concept of a language of flowers for American readers. She was the wife of William Wirt, Attorney General of the United States.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1809-10 seems to capture the moment when Elizabeth, then a young wife, had already begun to assemble the materials that would eventually form the basis of her famous Flora's Dictionary.
title: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt
name: Elizabeth Washington Gamble Wirt

description: William Bainbridge is a renowned United States Navy officer who served during the Quasi-War, the First and Second Barbary Wars, and the War of 1812, notably commanding the USS Constitution in its famous victory over the HMS Java.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1814 seems to capture the moment when William Bainbridge, having already experienced the tribulations of capture during the First Barbary War and proven his mettle in command of the USS Constitution during the War of 1812, is at the peak of his naval career, a seasoned veteran on the cusp of a new chapter in his life.
title: William Bainbridge
name: William Bainbridge

description: George Henry Durrie is a self-taught American landscape artist, best known for his rural winter snow scenes, especially after Currier and Ives reproduced his works as lithographic prints.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1843 seems to capture the moment when George Henry Durrie, a young artist, is transitioning from portrait painting to landscape, having recently married and started a family.
title: George Henry Durrie Self-Portrait
name: George Henry Durrie

description: William Baxter Palmer Closson is a well-known American painter and wood engraver known for his contributions to Harper's Magazine and other publications. He is also recognized for his artistic talent, having seventeen of his paintings displayed in the Smithsonian Institution's American Art collection.

mainEvents.description: Shared a studio with George Fuller

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900 seems to capture the moment when William Baxter Palmer Closson, a mature and accomplished artist, was at the peak of his career, having established himself as a prominent figure in the American art scene and contributing significantly to the visual arts.
title: William Closson Self-Portrait
name: William Baxter Palmer Closson

description: William Linn is a prominent figure in American history, serving as the first Chaplain of the United States House of Representatives and the second President of Rutgers University.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from College of New Jersey
First Chaplain of House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1805 seems to capture the moment when William Linn, a man in his early fifties, stood at a crossroads in his career.  He had served as the first Chaplain of the United States House of Representatives, a prestigious role, but had recently stepped down from that position. Now, he faced the challenges of leading Queen's College (later Rutgers University) through a period of financial hardship.
title: William Linn
name: William Linn

description: Elisha Tyson is a prominent American philanthropist, abolitionist, and businessman who dedicated his life to fighting slavery and aiding African Americans. He was a Quaker and a leading figure in the Underground Railroad.

mainEvents.description: Founded Maryland Society for the Abolition of Slavery

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1823 seems to capture the moment when Elisha Tyson, having established himself as a successful businessman and philanthropist, was actively involved in the abolitionist movement, using his wealth and influence to fight for the freedom of enslaved people.
title: Elisha Tyson
name: Elisha Tyson

description: Charlotte Saunders Cushman is a renowned American stage actress known for her powerful contralto voice and versatility, performing both male and female roles. She was a prominent figure in the American theatre, known for her passionate performances and dramatic talent. She was also part of a tempestuous private life with romantic relationships with women, some of which were scandalous at the time.

mainEvents.description: Cushman's successful stage debut in New Orleans
Cushman's first tour abroad and her subsequent success

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1836 seems to capture the moment when Charlotte Saunders Cushman was on the cusp of fame, having recently made her dramatic debut. Though she had a promising singing career, her powerful performance as Lady Macbeth in New Orleans launched her dramatic career, and shortly after this, she was on a trajectory to become a world-renowned actress.
title: Charlotte Cushman
name: Charlotte Saunders Cushman

description: Charles Willson Peale is a prominent American painter, soldier, scientist, inventor, politician, and naturalist who played a significant role in the American Revolution, founded the Philadelphia Museum, and is known for his portraits of notable figures, including George Washington.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1791 seems to capture the moment when Charles Willson Peale, a renowned artist and prominent figure in the early republic, stands at the pinnacle of his career, having already established himself as a leading portrait painter, a dedicated soldier in the American Revolution, and a pioneer in natural history.
title: Charles Willson Peale Self-Portrait
name: Charles Willson Peale

description: William Page is a renowned American painter and portrait artist, known for his intricate portraits, vibrant landscapes, and the controversy surrounding his evolving artistic style.

mainEvents.description: Died in Staten Island, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1830 seems to capture the moment when William Page, a young and promising artist, was still finding his artistic voice, having recently left theological studies to pursue painting full-time.
title: William Page Self-Portrait
name: William Page

description: Alexander Graham Bell is a Scottish-born Canadian-American inventor, scientist, and engineer best known for his invention of the telephone. He also co-founded AT&T in 1885. His mother and wife were deaf, and this significantly influenced his life's work.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1919 seems to capture the moment when Bell, already a scientific legend, is reflecting on the profound impact his invention has had on society and the world.
title: Alexander Graham Bell
name: Alexander Graham Bell

description: Adolfo Müller-Ury is a Swiss-born American painter known for his impressionistic rose paintings and portraits of prominent figures, including US presidents, international opera singers, and prominent socialites.

mainEvents.description: Painted portrait of Kaiser Wilhelm II

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1933 seems to capture the moment when Adolfo Müller-Ury, after a successful career painting the rich and powerful in New York, was beginning to find his artistic voice through his impressionistic rose paintings, foreshadowing his move to California in 1922 and subsequent development of his signature style.
title: Adolfo Müller-Ury Self-portrait
name: Adolfo Müller-Ury

description: George Fuller is a renowned American figure and portrait painter who left a lasting mark on the artistic landscape of the 19th century. He is known for his evocative depictions of rural life and his unique artistic style, blending realism with a touch of romanticism. Fuller also explored themes of social justice and the human condition in his paintings, making him a prominent figure in the American art scene. He is remembered for his powerful portraits of figures with captivating expressions, often set against idyllic rural landscapes.

mainEvents.description: Elected an associate of the National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in before 1860 seems to capture the moment when George Fuller, a young man driven by artistic passion, had just begun to make a name for himself as a painter. After years of pursuing his passion against his family's wishes, he had finally found a path forward, embracing his artistic talents and leaving behind a life of mundane work. The portrait might reflect his early success, a turning point in his life, filled with a quiet determination and a hopeful gaze towards the future.
title: George Fuller Self-Portrait
name: George Fuller

description: Frederick William MacMonnies is a renowned American-French sculptor and painter known for his Beaux-Arts style, prominent public works, and prolific output.

mainEvents.description: Born in Brooklyn Heights, New York
Nathan Hale Statue in New York City
Columbian Fountain at the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago
Civic Virtue fountain for New York City Hall

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1885-1900 seems to capture the moment when MacMonnies, still in his early twenties, had begun to find success in Paris, and his career as a sculptor was about to take off.
title: Frederick William MacMonnies Self-Portrait
name: Frederick William MacMonnies

description: Louis Michel Eilshemius is a self-taught American painter who gained fame for his unconventional style and often fantastical landscapes populated by nymphs.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1915 seems to capture the moment when Eilshemius was transitioning from his early, more traditional landscapes towards the fantastical, visionary style that would define his later work, showcasing his unique artistic vision.
title: Louis Michel Eilshemius Self-Portrait
name: Louis Michel Eilshemius

description: Carl Wimar is a German-American painter known for his evocative depictions of Native American life on the Great Plains, particularly their buffalo hunts and nomadic ways. He was also a pioneer in portraying emigrant wagon trains traversing the vast Western landscapes.

mainEvents.description: Painted murals in the St. Louis Court House

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1850-62 seems to capture the moment when Carl Wimar was at the cusp of his artistic maturity, having honed his skills at the Düsseldorf Academy and begun to explore the themes that would define his legacy - the vibrant and vanishing world of the Native Americans on the Great Plains.
title: Carl Wimar Self-Portrait
name: Carl Wimar

description: Robert Richford Roberts is a prominent figure in American Methodist history, known for his service as a circuit rider, pastor, presiding elder, and bishop. He was the first married man to serve as a bishop in the Methodist Episcopal Church, known for his humble demeanor and dedication to missions in the West.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1840 seems to capture the moment when Bishop Roberts, in his early 60s, was a seasoned leader of the Methodist Episcopal Church, having served as a bishop for nearly 25 years and witnessed significant growth in the church, especially in the Western United States.
title: Robert Richford Roberts
name: Robert Richford Roberts

description: Gilbert Stuart is a renowned American painter known for his iconic portraits of prominent figures, including George Washington, whose likeness on the US one-dollar bill is based on Stuart's work. Stuart's artistic legacy includes over 1,000 portraits that captured the essence of American society in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1825? seems to capture the moment when Gilbert Stuart, nearing the end of his illustrious career, had established himself as a leading American portraitist.  His signature style, marked by vibrant brushstrokes and an uncanny ability to capture the personality of his subjects, had matured over decades of dedicated work.
title: Gilbert Stuart
name: Gilbert Stuart

description: John Quincy Adams Ward is a renowned American sculptor, known for his larger-than-life statues of historical figures like George Washington and his monumental bronze sculptures like "The Pilgrim", a 9-foot tall stylized representation of a Pilgrim.

mainEvents.description: President of the National Academy of Design
President of the National Sculpture Society

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1868 seems to capture the moment when John Quincy Adams Ward was on the verge of a significant career shift, transitioning from creating portrait busts and monuments to embracing large-scale public sculpture. It was a period marked by prolific creations and national recognition, as seen in "The Good Samaritan Ether Monument" and the "Matthew Perry Monument", completed the year before.
title: John Quincy Adams Ward
name: John Quincy Adams Ward

description: Charles Wilkes is a notable American explorer and naval officer who led the United States Exploring Expedition, which significantly contributed to scientific knowledge and mapped vast territories.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1870 seems to capture the moment when Charles Wilkes, at the age of 72, was reflecting on a life filled with both scientific triumphs and controversies, as he had recently retired from naval service after a long and tumultuous career.
title: Charles Wilkes
name: Charles Wilkes

description: Francis Asbury is a British-American Methodist minister who became one of the first two bishops of the Methodist Episcopal Church in the United States, known for his tireless evangelism and his extensive travels throughout the colonies and the newly formed nation.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1813 seems to capture the moment when Francis Asbury, despite facing failing health and the challenges of a burgeoning nation, remained steadfast in his commitment to spreading the Methodist faith throughout the land.
title: Francis Asbury
name: Francis Asbury

description: Ernest Lawson is a Canadian-American Impressionist painter known for his landscapes, particularly those depicting the transitioning urban landscape of New York City. He was a member of The Eight, a group of artists who broke away from the restrictive practices of the National Academy of Design and advocated for a more diverse and modern approach to art.

mainEvents.description: Lawson joined National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when Ernest Lawson was at the height of his artistic powers, having established himself as a leading member of The Eight and a respected landscape painter. His work, influenced by his teachers John Henry Twachtman and J. Alden Weir, reflected his unique perspective on the urbanizing landscape of New York City, a time of transition and transformation that he captured with both realism and poetic sensibility.
title: Ernest Lawson
name: Ernest Lawson

description: Alfred Bult Mullett is a British-American architect who served as Supervising Architect of the US Treasury Department, overseeing design of many federal buildings across the country.

mainEvents.description: Became Supervising Architect of US Treasury Dept.
Died by suicide in Washington, D.C.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1880-82 seems to capture the moment when Alfred Bult Mullett was at a crossroads in his career: having faced political and personal struggles despite his many architectural achievements, he is embarking on a new chapter with his sons in private practice.
title: Alfred Bult Mullett
name: Alfred Bult Mullett

description: Daniel Huntington is a prominent American artist who belonged to the Hudson River School movement before becoming renowned for his portraiture.

mainEvents.description: Elected President of the National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when Huntington was transitioning from his landscape paintings of the Hudson River School to a career focused on portraits.
title: Daniel Huntington
name: Daniel Huntington

description: Lester Wallack is a renowned American actor-manager, known for his captivating performances in light comedies and romantic roles. He managed three Wallack's Theatres in New York City, contributing significantly to the development of American theatre.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1866? seems to capture the moment when Lester Wallack, at the height of his career, is a beloved and respected figure in the American theatre scene. He is managing his second Wallack's Theatre, known for its elegant productions, and his charisma and charm are evident on stage.
title: Lester Wallack
name: Lester Wallack

description: Edward Hicks is a 19th-century American folk artist and distinguished religious minister of the Society of Friends (aka "Quakers"). He is best known for his numerous versions of "The Peaceable Kingdom", paintings that depict animals and humans coexisting peacefully, and for his devout Quaker beliefs.  Hicks, born in 1780, was a gifted painter, a dedicated minister, and a devoted family man, whose artwork reflects his deeply held Quaker principles.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1839 seems to capture the moment when Edward Hicks, now a prominent Quaker minister and artist, was reaching the peak of his creative output.  Having established himself as a painter and preacher, he was able to fully express his beliefs through his art, most notably in "The Peaceable Kingdom" series.
title: Edward Hicks Painting the Peaceable Kingdom
name: Edward Hicks

description: Anson Phelps Stokes is a prominent American educator, historian, clergyman, author, philanthropist, and civil rights activist known for his work at Yale University, his advocacy for racial equality, and his contributions to the Phelps Stokes Fund.

mainEvents.description: Born in New Brighton, Staten Island

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1900 seems to capture the moment when Anson Phelps Stokes, newly established as Secretary of Yale University, stood at the cusp of a life dedicated to both academic excellence and social justice, his future brimming with the potential to shape both the university's landscape and the fight for racial equality.
title: Anson Phelps Stokes
name: Anson Phelps Stokes

description: George Inness is a 19th-century American landscape painter, renowned for his evocative landscapes that seamlessly blend realism and spirituality. His work, often influenced by the Hudson River School and Barbizon artists, reveals a unique and deeply personal style.

mainEvents.description: Died in Bridge of Allan, Scotland
Elected to National Academy of Design
Received Gold Medal at Paris Exposition

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1890-1928 seems to capture the moment when Inness's art had matured, reflecting his profound understanding of the interconnectedness between nature and the spiritual realm. He was nearing the end of his career, his paintings resonating with a rich palette and ethereal atmosphere.
title: George Inness
name: George Inness

description: Varina Howell Davis is a prominent figure in American history, known as the only First Lady of the Confederate States of America and the wife of President Jefferson Davis. She was a controversial figure during the Civil War, holding unconventional views on slavery and the war itself, and later became a writer and reconciled with figures from both sides of the conflict.

mainEvents.description: Became First Lady of the Confederacy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849 seems to capture the moment when Varina Howell Davis was a young, intelligent, and ambitious woman, poised on the precipice of a life marked by both love and loss, privilege and hardship, and the tumultuous events that would shape her destiny and the nation.
title: Varina Howell Davis
name: Varina Howell Davis

description: Valentine Mott is a pioneering American surgeon known for his groundbreaking surgical techniques, particularly in the area of vascular surgery, and for his contributions to medical education.

mainEvents.description: Born in Glen Cove, New York
Appointed Professor of Surgery at Columbia College
Performed the first carotid artery ligation in the US

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1820 seems to capture the moment when Valentine Mott, already a renowned surgeon and professor, was on the cusp of his most significant contributions to vascular surgery, a field he would help pioneer with his groundbreaking operations.
title: Valentine Mott
name: Valentine Mott

description: Margery Winifred Williams Bianco is a prolific English-American author best known for her beloved children's book, The Velveteen Rabbit. Her literary career spanned over four decades, and her works often explored themes of love, loss, and the power of imagination.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when Margery Williams Bianco, a young and ambitious writer, is about to embark on a journey that will forever change her life and the lives of countless children.  She has already published several novels aimed at an adult audience, but it is in the years to come that her talent for writing children's books will truly blossom.
title: Margery Williams
name: Margery Winifred Williams Bianco

description: Albert Pinkham Ryder is a prominent American painter known for his moody seascapes and allegorical works, notable for their unique blend of tonalist techniques and pre-modernist form.

mainEvents.description: First painting exhibited at the National Academy of Design
Became a founding member of the Society of American Artists
Ten paintings featured in the historic Armory Show

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in  seems to capture the moment when Ryder's artistic genius was at its peak, a time when his paintings were met with critical acclaim and his unique style was gaining recognition among his contemporaries.
title: Albert Pinkham Ryder
name: Albert Pinkham Ryder

description: Daniel Leonard is a lawyer and Loyalist, known for his advocacy of British rule during the American Revolution. He is remembered for his powerful arguments in defense of royal authority.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1770 seems to capture the moment when Leonard, a young lawyer with rising influence, was caught in the crossfire of the escalating American Revolution, forced to choose between his loyalty to his homeland and his commitment to his colony.
title: Daniel Leonard
name: Daniel Leonard

description: Joseph Henry is a prominent American scientist recognized for his pioneering work in electromagnetism, the invention of the electric doorbell and relay, and his service as the first secretary of the Smithsonian Institution.

mainEvents.description: Appointed first secretary of Smithsonian Institution

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1885 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Henry, having established the Smithsonian Institution as a prominent scientific hub and revolutionized electromagnetism, reflects on a lifetime of discovery and innovation.
title: Joseph Henry
name: Joseph Henry

description: Joseph Galloway is a prominent American Loyalist, lawyer, and politician who played a key role in the events leading to the American Revolution and remained loyal to the British crown throughout the conflict. He served as a delegate to the First Continental Congress and was a member of the Pennsylvania Provincial Assembly.

mainEvents.description: Delegate to the First Continental Congress
Fled to England after the Declaration of Independence

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1775 seems to capture the moment when Galloway, at the height of his political career, was a prominent figure in the escalating tensions between Britain and the American colonies, a time when he believed in the possibility of a united empire and sought to bridge the growing divide, but also a time when his conservative views and strong loyalty to the Crown were increasingly at odds with the revolutionary sentiment.
title: Joseph Galloway
name: Joseph Galloway

description: John Bradstreet is a British Army officer who served in North America during the French and Indian War and Pontiac's War. He was known for his leadership in military campaigns and his contributions to British logistics.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1764 seems to capture the moment when John Bradstreet, having achieved the rank of Colonel and distinguished himself in the French and Indian War,  is now dealing with the ramifications of Pontiac's rebellion, and the challenges of maintaining British dominance in the newly acquired territory.
title: General John Bradstreet
name: John Bradstreet

description: William Linn is a prominent figure in American history, serving as the second president of Rutgers University and the first chaplain of the United States House of Representatives, demonstrating his dedication to both education and public service.

mainEvents.description: William Linn became the first chaplain of the House of Representatives
William Linn became the second president of Queen's College (now Rutgers University)
William Linn died in Albany, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in early 1790s seems to capture the moment when William Linn, a young man with a promising future, stood at the crossroads of his career, having served as the first Chaplain of the U.S. House of Representatives and having recently accepted the presidency of Queen's College, a prestigious academic institution.
title: William Linn
name: William Linn

description: Charles Franklin Kettering is a renowned American inventor and engineer who revolutionized the automotive industry with his inventions like the electric starting motor and leaded gasoline.

mainEvents.description: Became head of research at General Motors

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1930s seems to capture the moment when Charles Kettering, after the success of the electric self-starter and leaded gasoline, stood at the precipice of further groundbreaking research, ready to tackle the challenges of future technologies.
title: Charles Franklin Kettering
name: Charles Franklin Kettering

description: William Carmichael is a prominent figure in American diplomacy during and after the Revolutionary War, known for his role in securing American interests in Europe, particularly as Chargé d'Affaires to Spain.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1770s seems to capture the moment when William Carmichael, a young diplomat, was establishing his reputation on the European stage,  building relationships with influential figures and navigating complex political intrigues.
title: William Carmichael
name: William Carmichael

description: Gustavus Franklin Swift is a prominent American entrepreneur who revolutionized the meatpacking industry in the late 19th century, establishing a meat-packing empire in the Midwest and pioneering the use of refrigerated rail cars, transforming meat distribution and ushering in the era of cheap beef.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1904 seems to capture the moment when Gustavus Franklin Swift, at the pinnacle of his career, was on the cusp of immense success, having built a powerful meatpacking empire and revolutionized the way meat was transported and consumed.
title: Gustavus Franklin Swift
name: Gustavus Franklin Swift

description: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson is a prominent figure in American history, best known for her marriage to President Woodrow Wilson and her influential role as First Lady during his presidency. She was known for her intelligence, strength of character, and her role in managing the presidency after Wilson's incapacitating stroke.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1924 seems to capture the moment when Edith Bolling Galt Wilson, having navigated the turbulent years of Woodrow Wilson's presidency, stands as a stoic figure, her strength forged in the fires of political and personal challenges, reflecting the weighty responsibilities she had borne.
title: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson
name: Edith Bolling Galt Wilson

description: John Henry Patterson is a pioneering industrialist and the founder of the National Cash Register Company, known for his innovative business practices and philanthropy.

mainEvents.description: Led recovery efforts during the Great Dayton Flood

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1920 seems to capture the moment when John Henry Patterson, having established NCR as a leading company and navigating through the challenges of antitrust lawsuits, is on the cusp of his philanthropic endeavors, a pivotal moment in his life.
title: John Henry Patterson
name: John Henry Patterson

description: Elisha Kent Kane is a prominent 19th-century Arctic explorer and U.S. Navy medical officer who led two expeditions in search of Sir John Franklin's lost expedition. He's known for his perseverance, navigating further North than any other explorer at the time, and advocating for a temperate polar sea.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1857 seems to capture the moment when Elisha Kent Kane, after returning from his second arduous Arctic expedition, is faced with his declining health, yet still carries the fervor of his explorations and the hope for future discoveries.
title: Elisha Kent Kane
name: Elisha Kent Kane

description: Samuel Ringgold is a prominent American Army artillery officer known for his contributions to modern artillery tactics. He was the first U.S. officer to die in the Mexican-American War, a casualty of the Battle of Palo Alto.

mainEvents.description: Samuel Ringgold writes field artillery manual.
Samuel Ringgold fights at Battle of Palo Alto.
Samuel Ringgold dies from battle wounds.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1825 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Ringgold, a young artillery officer, stands at the precipice of his career, having recently graduated West Point and served on the staff of General Winfield Scott.
title: Samuel Ringgold
name: Samuel Ringgold

description: Charles Nagel is a prominent American lawyer and politician who served as the U.S. Secretary of Commerce and Labor during President Taft's administration. He played a key role in founding the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and was a corporate attorney for Adolphus Busch.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the Missouri House of Representatives
Served as Secretary of Commerce and Labor

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1901 seems to capture the moment when Charles Nagel, at the cusp of his political career, is about to step into the national spotlight, having achieved recognition as a respected lawyer and politician in St. Louis.
title: Charles Nagel
name: Charles Nagel

description: John Summerfield is a British-born Methodist preacher known for his passionate sermons and missionary work, particularly in Dublin and America. He was imprisoned for his former dissolute life before becoming a prominent preacher and social activist.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1821-25 seems to capture the moment when John Summerfield, a rising star in the Methodist movement, was leaving his mark on America, just as he was beginning to be recognized for his extraordinary oratory and evangelistic zeal.
title: John Summerfield
name: John Summerfield

description: Carter Braxton is a Founding Father, signer of the Declaration of Independence, merchant, and Virginia planter who served in the Virginia House of Burgesses and the Continental Congress. He was a moderate politician who played a key role in the early years of the American Revolution.  Braxton also faced financial challenges and was deeply involved in commerce and trade during and after the war.

mainEvents.description: Born in King and Queen County, Virginia
Elected to the Council of State

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1775 seems to capture the moment when Carter Braxton was a successful merchant and planter who had already begun to make his mark in Virginia politics, but before the revolutionary fervor had fully taken hold. This was a time when Braxton was a rising star in Virginia society, known for his intelligence, wealth, and connections. The portrait reflects his strong character and the confident demeanor that would later lead him to sign the Declaration of Independence.
title: Carter Braxton
name: Carter Braxton

description: Sidney Hillman is a pioneering American labor leader, known for his role in establishing the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America and the Congress of Industrial Organizations, and for his influence on the New Deal.

mainEvents.description: Helped form Congress of Industrial Organizations
Died at Point Lookout, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Sidney Hillman was at the height of his influence, having just helped to establish the CIO and a few years after he had secured major gains for the ACWA during the Great Depression.
title: Sidney Hillman
name: Sidney Hillman

description: Joseph Jefferson is a renowned American actor and author known for his comedic brilliance and iconic portrayal of Rip Van Winkle on stage and in early silent films.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1871 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Jefferson, already a well-established comedian, is beginning to achieve international fame with his iconic performance as Rip Van Winkle, following successful runs in Australia and London.
title: Joseph Jefferson
name: Joseph Jefferson

description: Sarah Porter is a pioneering American educator who founded Miss Porter's School, a prestigious private college preparatory school for girls. She played a pivotal role in expanding educational opportunities for women in the 19th century.

mainEvents.description: Became president of Miss Porter's School

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1896 seems to capture the moment when Sarah Porter, after decades of dedicated work, had built Miss Porter's School into a nationally acclaimed institution, and her legacy as a visionary educator was secured.
title: Sarah Porter
name: Sarah Porter

description: Horatio Greenough is a prominent American sculptor known for his classical style and influential writings on art, particularly the concept of 'form follows function'. He was commissioned by the U.S. government for works like 'The Rescue' and 'George Washington'.

mainEvents.description: Sailed to Rome to study art

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1829 seems to capture the moment when Horatio Greenough was a young artist, already establishing a name for himself with his naturalism and classical influence, having returned to Boston after a period of study in Rome, a crucial period for his artistic development.
title: Horatio Greenough
name: Horatio Greenough

description: John Howard Raymond is a prominent American educator, known for his role as the first president of the Polytechnic Institute of New York University, and his crucial involvement in establishing Vassar College.

mainEvents.description: Born in Manhattan, New York City

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1845 seems to capture the moment when John Howard Raymond, a rising star in the field of education, is poised to take on the challenge of shaping the future of Vassar College, a young institution he had recently joined.
title: John Howard Raymond
name: John Howard Raymond

description: Richard Watson Gilder is a prominent American poet and editor, known for his work on "The Century Magazine" and his involvement in various social reform movements.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1902-03 seems to capture the moment when Gilder, at the peak of his editorial career, was a leading figure in American literary and social circles, advocating for reform while promoting the works of prominent writers.
title: Richard Watson Gilder
name: Richard Watson Gilder

description: Robert Hare is a pioneering American chemist known for his invention of the oxy-hydrogen blowpipe, the galvanic deflagrator, and his later involvement in Spiritualism.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the American Philosophical Society

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1856 seems to capture the moment when Robert Hare, nearing the end of his long and illustrious career, looks back upon a lifetime of scientific innovation and discovery, perhaps pondering his controversial embrace of Spiritualism.
title: Robert Hare
name: Robert Hare

description: Newton Booth Tarkington is a prolific American novelist and dramatist known for his works like "The Magnificent Ambersons" and "Alice Adams", which explored themes of social mobility and the American class system. He was one of only four novelists to win the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction more than once. During the early 20th century, he was considered the United States' greatest living author.

mainEvents.description: Won the Pulitzer Prize for "The Magnificent Ambersons"
Won the Pulitzer Prize for "Alice Adams"

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in late 19th-early 20th century seems to capture the moment when Tarkington's early success as a novelist, reflected in works like "The Gentleman from Indiana", was solidified. He was already a respected figure in American literature, beginning a prolific career that would see him become one of the most popular and celebrated authors of his time, even as he was critical of the modernization of his home state of Indiana.
title: Newton Booth Tarkington
name: Newton Booth Tarkington

description: Gilbert Stuart is a prominent American portrait painter known for his iconic portraits of George Washington, including the 'Athenaeum Portrait' which appears on the US one-dollar bill. He was also a prolific artist who painted numerous prominent figures in American society.

mainEvents.description: Began painting portraits of George Washington

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1825 seems to capture the moment when Gilbert Stuart, already a renowned artist and a significant figure in American art, was experiencing a period of both triumph and hardship. He had achieved fame and financial success through his portraits of George Washington, but his life was also marked by financial struggles and personal tragedies.
title: Gilbert Stuart
name: Gilbert Stuart

description: Henry Ward Ranger is a prominent American landscape and marine painter, known for his Tonalist style and leadership of the Old Lyme Art Colony. He became a National Academician and a member of the American Water Color Society, contributing significantly to the development of American art.

mainEvents.description: Established the Old Lyme Art Colony

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1897-1928 seems to capture the moment when Henry Ward Ranger, having established himself as a respected Tonalist painter, was at the height of his creative energy, influencing the artistic landscape of America with his innovative style and leadership of the Old Lyme Art Colony.
title: Henry Ward Ranger
name: Henry Ward Ranger

description: William Morris Hunt is a prominent American painter of the 19th century known for his landscapes, portraits, and influence on the Barbizon School in the US.

mainEvents.description: Studied in Paris with Thomas Couture
Elected to the National Academy of Design
Died at the Isles of Shoals, New Hampshire

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1850 seems to capture the moment when William Morris Hunt, having studied with Thomas Couture and Jean-François Millet in Paris, is on the verge of becoming a leading American painter, shortly before returning to the US and establishing his own art schools.
title: William Morris Hunt
name: William Morris Hunt

description: Henry Kirke Brown is a prominent American sculptor known for his equestrian statues and monumental figures, including those of George Washington, Abraham Lincoln, and Nathanael Greene.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Henry Kirke Brown, at the peak of his career, was recognized as a leading sculptor of his generation, having completed iconic works like the equestrian statue of George Washington in Union Square.
title: Henry Kirke Brown
name: Henry Kirke Brown

description: William James is a pioneering American philosopher and psychologist, known for establishing pragmatism and functional psychology. His groundbreaking work on consciousness, emotion, and religious experience continues to influence academics today.

mainEvents.description: James published 'The Varieties of Religious Experience'.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1859 seems to capture the moment when William James, still a young man, was struggling to find his calling, a moment of transition between his initial medical studies and his eventual path toward philosophy and psychology.
title: William James
name: William James

description: Richard Alexander F. Penrose Jr. is a prominent American mining geologist and entrepreneur known for his contributions to economic geology, his philanthropy, and his presidency of the Geological Society of America.

mainEvents.description: Graduated from Harvard with a Ph.D.
Elected as the President of GSA

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the late 1920s seems to capture the moment when Penrose, at the peak of his career, reflects on his achievements as a mining geologist, investor, and philanthropist, having established the Penrose Medal of the Geological Society of America, a lasting legacy of his passion for the field.
title: Richard Alexander F. Penrose, Jr.
name: Richard Alexander F. Penrose Jr.

description: John Russell Pope is a renowned American architect known for designing significant public buildings like the National Archives, the Jefferson Memorial, and the National Gallery of Art, all in Washington, D.C.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1930s seems to capture the moment when John Russell Pope, already an established and respected architect, was at the peak of his career, having designed some of the most iconic buildings in the nation's capital.  His legacy is cemented in the neoclassical masterpieces he left behind.
title: John Russell Pope
name: John Russell Pope

description: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon is a prominent American heiress who married George Curzon, the future Viceroy of India, and became the Vicereine of India. She was known for her beauty, charm, and role in promoting Indian art and culture.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1901 seems to capture the moment when Lady Curzon, at the height of her social and political influence in India, radiated the confidence and elegance befitting a Vicereine, yet foreshadowed the tragic end that would come just a few years later.
title: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon
name: Lady Mary Victoria Leiter Curzon

description: Frank Duveneck is a prominent American figure and portrait painter known for his realistic, dark style and influential teaching, impacting generations of artists.

mainEvents.description: Studied at the Royal Academy of Munich

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1890 seems to capture the moment when Frank Duveneck, already a celebrated artist, had reached a period of quiet reflection, perhaps after the tragic loss of his wife Elizabeth in 1888, and before he returned to teaching and sculpting.
title: Frank Duveneck Self-Portrait
name: Frank Duveneck

description: Henry Mosler is a German-born painter who documented American life, including colonial themes, Civil War illustrations, and portraits of men and women of society. He was an accomplished artist whose works are in many prestigious collections.

mainEvents.description: Moved to New York with family
Served as art correspondent of Harper's Weekly
Moved to New York, opened studio in Carnegie Hall

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1907 seems to capture the moment when Henry Mosler had reached the pinnacle of his career, having established himself as a respected artist in New York City, where he had just recently moved his family from France.
title: Henry Mosler Self-portrait
name: Henry Mosler

description: Matthew Pratt is a Colonial Era American painter known for his portraits of American men and women. He studied under his uncle, James Claypoole, and later traveled to England where he studied under Benjamin West. He is best known for his painting "The American School", which depicts a group of American artists in West's London studio.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1764 seems to capture the moment when Matthew Pratt, still young and ambitious, arrived in England, ready to embark on a period of artistic growth and development under the tutelage of Benjamin West, a rising star in the English art world.
title: Matthew Pratt Self-Portrait
name: Matthew Pratt

description: George Gershwin is a prolific American composer and pianist known for blending jazz and classical music, creating iconic works like Rhapsody in Blue and Porgy and Bess, a groundbreaking opera.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1934 seems to capture the moment when George Gershwin was at the peak of his musical powers, having already achieved fame with Rhapsody in Blue and An American in Paris, and on the cusp of creating his masterpiece, Porgy and Bess.
title: George Gershwin Self-Portrait
name: George Gershwin

description: William Dunlap is a prolific American playwright, painter, and historian, known for his contributions to theater and his significant role in documenting the development of American art.

mainEvents.description: Dunlap co-founded the National Academy of Design.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1805 seems to capture the moment when William Dunlap, after a successful career in theater, had transitioned back to his first passion, painting, now a master craftsman in both worlds.
title: William Dunlap self-portrait
name: William Dunlap

description: William Auerbach-Levy is a Belarusian-born American artist of Jewish origin known for his paintings, etchings, and caricatures of celebrities and theatrical personalities, often published in notable magazines. He authored several books on caricature and was awarded a Guggenheim Fellowship in 1928.

mainEvents.description: Elected to National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1912 seems to capture the moment when Auerbach-Levy was at the height of his career, a celebrated caricaturist already recognized for his talent and contributions to the art world. He had already achieved success in the United States, published his work in major magazines, and was on the verge of being elected to the National Academy of Design.
title: William Auerbach-Levy Self-Portrait
name: William Auerbach-Levy

description: Rubens Peale is a prominent American museum administrator and painter, known for his contributions to museums and the family legacy of art.

mainEvents.description: Became director of his father's Philadelphia Museum
Opened his own museum in New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1807 seems to capture the moment when Rubens Peale, a young man with a passion for art and a strong sense of family, is beginning to make his mark on the world, while still under the influence of his father's legacy and artistic ideals.
title: Rubens Peale
name: Rubens Peale

description: Benjamin Silliman is a pioneering American chemist and science educator who revolutionized scientific education at Yale University. He established the American Journal of Science, the nation's longest-running scientific journal, and his research spanned fields from geology and mineralogy to the distillation of petroleum.

mainEvents.description: Became a chemistry professor at Yale
Founded the American Journal of Science
Discovered the first articulated fossil fishes in the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1825 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin Silliman, a renowned scientist and educator, stands at the pinnacle of his career. Having established himself as a pioneer in American science and education, his influence is felt across the nation, as he inspires future generations of scientists and scholars.
title: Benjamin Silliman
name: Benjamin Silliman

description: Benjamin West is a prominent Anglo-American historical painter who rose to prominence in England for his dramatic and large-scale paintings, notably "The Death of General Wolfe." He was also a founding member of the Royal Academy and its President for much of his career.

mainEvents.description: Elected President of the Royal Academy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1808-09 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin West, now in his 70s, had reached the pinnacle of his career, having achieved both artistic and social success in England, including the presidency of the Royal Academy.
title: West Family in the Studio Garden
name: Benjamin West

description: George Caleb Bingham is a prominent American artist, soldier, and politician who gained recognition as "the Missouri Artist". He was a self-taught artist who became known for his captivating paintings of American frontier life and his participation in the Civil War.

mainEvents.description: Elected to Missouri House of Representatives
Fought in the Civil War as a Union captain

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1849-50 seems to capture the moment when Bingham was at the height of his artistic success and political influence. It is a period where he had already gained recognition for his depictions of frontier life and was actively engaged in politics, advocating for the abolition of slavery. This portrait signifies a critical point in his life where his artistic and political aspirations converged.
title: George Caleb Bingham Self-Portrait
name: George Caleb Bingham

description: Arvid Frederick Nyholm is a Swedish-American artist known for his portrait and landscape paintings. He studied with Anders Zorn, exhibited widely, and was a founding member of the Swedish-American Art Association.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1924 seems to capture the moment when Arvid Frederick Nyholm was at the peak of his artistic career. He had already achieved significant recognition for his portraiture, including commissions for prominent figures like Daniel Hudson Burnham and Adolph Olson Eberhart. The year 1924 also saw him winning the Municipal Art League Portrait Prize for the second time, marking a significant milestone in his artistic journey.
title: Arvid Frederick Nyholm Self-Portrait
name: Arvid Frederick Nyholm

description: Edmund Charles Tarbell is a prominent American Impressionist painter known for his richly hued images of figures in landscapes and interiors, often depicting his family. He was a member of the Ten American Painters and a key figure in the Boston School of painting.

mainEvents.description: Became a member of the Ten American Painters
Co-founded The Guild of Boston Artists
Died in New Castle, New Hampshire

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Edmund Charles Tarbell, a renowned Impressionist painter, was at the peak of his career, having established himself as a prominent figure in the Boston School and a member of the Ten American Painters. His influence on American art was undeniable, as his work was sought after by major museums and collectors.
title: Edmund Charles Tarbell Self-Portrait
name: Edmund Charles Tarbell

description: Edwin Thomas Booth is a renowned American stage actor and theatrical manager known for his captivating Shakespearean performances, founding Booth's Theatre, and overcoming the shadow of his brother's assassination of President Lincoln.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Edwin Booth, having established himself as a rising star, was navigating the complexities of his career amidst the shadow of the Civil War, which had begun two years earlier.
title: Edwin Booth
name: Edwin Thomas Booth

description: Edwin Forrest is a renowned American Shakespearean actor of the 19th century, known for his intense performances and his rivalry with British actor William Macready, which culminated in the Astor Place Riot.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1840 seems to capture the moment when Edwin Forrest, at the peak of his career, was celebrated for his dramatic intensity and powerful portrayals of Shakespearean heroes.
title: Edwin Forrest
name: Edwin Forrest

description: Washington Irving is a renowned American author, historian, and diplomat, best known for his short stories "Rip Van Winkle" and "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow." He also wrote historical works and biographies of prominent figures.

mainEvents.description: Served as US Minister to Spain

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1860 seems to capture the moment when Washington Irving, a veteran of American literature, had solidified his reputation as a master storyteller.  He was nearing the end of his life, and his career was marked by success and recognition, both in the United States and abroad.
title: Washington Irving
name: Washington Irving

description: Benjamin West is a renowned British-American painter known for his historical and religious subjects, who became the second president of the Royal Academy and influenced many other artists.

mainEvents.description: Became President of the Royal Academy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1770 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin West had achieved early success in England and was becoming recognized for his historical paintings, particularly "The Death of General Wolfe," which would soon become one of his most famous works.
title: Benjamin West
name: Benjamin West

description: Van Wyck Brooks is a prominent American literary critic, biographer, and historian who played a crucial role in shaping American cultural consciousness. His writings on American literature and its evolution, notably the "Makers and Finders" series, continue to be influential. He was the recipient of a Pulitzer Prize for History in 1937 for his book, "The Flowering of New England, 1815–1865".

mainEvents.description: Won Pulitzer Prize for "The Flowering of New England"

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1909 seems to capture the moment when Van Wyck Brooks, recently graduated from Harvard, was on the cusp of establishing his literary career. It was a time of great intellectual and cultural ferment in America, and Brooks was poised to become a leading voice in the debates about American identity and the role of literature in shaping it.
title: Van Wyck Brooks
name: Van Wyck Brooks

description: Jean Louis Lefebvre de Cheverus is a French-born Catholic prelate who served as the first Bishop of Boston, Bishop of Montauban, and Archbishop of Bordeaux. He was elevated to the cardinalate in 1836. He is known for his charitable work and his efforts to improve relations between Catholics and Protestants in the United States.

mainEvents.description: Became the first Bishop of Boston

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1823 seems to capture the moment when Jean Louis Lefebvre de Cheverus, having served as the first Bishop of Boston for 15 years, is called to return to his native France, leaving behind a legacy of interfaith harmony and social reform.
title: Jean Louis Lefebvre de Cheverus
name: Jean Louis Lefebvre de Cheverus

description: Gen. George Rogers Clark is a pivotal figure in American history, famed for his military leadership during the Revolutionary War, particularly his successful campaigns in the Illinois country, which greatly weakened British control of the Northwest Territory. Clark's strategic brilliance secured this vast region for the newly formed United States, solidifying his legacy as "Conqueror of the Old Northwest" and earning him a place among America's early military heroes.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1810 seems to capture the moment when Gen. George Rogers Clark, despite facing accusations and financial hardship, still holds onto the hope for a brighter future, reflecting his enduring spirit and the anticipation of a new era for the young nation he helped shape.
title: George Rogers Clark
name: Gen. George Rogers Clark

description: Albert James Myer is a prominent figure in American military history, known for his invention of wig-wag signaling and establishing the U.S. Army Signal Corps and the U.S. Weather Bureau.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1876 seems to capture the moment when Albert James Myer, at the height of his career, had established the U.S. Army Signal Corps and was on the verge of founding the U.S. Weather Bureau, pioneering advancements in military communications and meteorology.
title: Albert James Myer
name: Albert James Myer

description: Anson Greene Phelps is a prominent American entrepreneur, businessman, and philanthropist, best known as the co-founder of Phelps, Dodge & Co., a company that became a major force in mining in the American West.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1854 seems to capture the moment when Anson Greene Phelps, at the pinnacle of his career,  was  firmly established as a leading figure in American commerce, having built a fortune through international trade and diversified business ventures.
title: Anson Greene Phelps
name: Anson Greene Phelps

description: John Rutledge is a prominent Founding Father, politician, and jurist who served as an original Supreme Court Justice, the second Chief Justice, the first president of South Carolina, and its first governor after independence. He was a leading figure in the Stamp Act Congress and the Constitutional Convention.

mainEvents.description: Appointed associate justice of the Supreme Court
Served as Chief Justice of the US

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1791 seems to capture the moment when John Rutledge was at the pinnacle of his political career, having served as governor of South Carolina during the Revolutionary War and having just resigned from the Supreme Court to become chief justice of the South Carolina Court of Common Pleas and Sessions.
title: John Rutledge
name: John Rutledge

description: King Camp Gillette is a renowned American entrepreneur and inventor, best known for his revolutionary invention of the safety razor and the creation of the Gillette Safety Razor Company, which popularized the "razor-razor blade" business model. His impact on the world of shaving and disposable products is undeniable.

mainEvents.description: Born in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin.
Founded the American Safety Razor Company.
Gillette Safety Razor Company began production.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1911 seems to capture the moment when King Camp Gillette had established his legacy as the "Father of the Disposable Razor". His company, now a global giant, was rapidly expanding, his innovation had transformed shaving, and his utopian socialist writings were gaining attention.
title: King Camp Gillette
name: King Camp Gillette

description: Enoch Crosby is a celebrated American Revolutionary War spy whose life may have inspired the character Harvey Birch in James Fenimore Cooper's novel "The Spy".

mainEvents.description: Enoch Crosby is born in Harwich, Massachusetts
Enoch Crosby joins the Continental Army
Enoch Crosby is recruited as a spy by John Jay
Enoch Crosby escapes from American capture during a mock trial
Enoch Crosby dies at the age of 85

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1830 seems to capture the moment when Enoch Crosby, having served as a spy for the Continental Army and survived multiple captures, enjoys the peace of his farm, reflecting on his daring service to the fledgling nation.
title: Enoch Crosby
name: Enoch Crosby

description: Red Cloud is a renowned Oglala Lakota leader who skillfully led his people against the United States Army during Red Cloud's War, achieving victory in the Fetterman Fight and securing the Treaty of Fort Laramie (1868). He was also a prominent figure in the transition to reservation life and remains a respected historical figure among the Lakota.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1910-30, after 1899 original seems to capture the moment when Red Cloud, a seasoned elder, reflects on the complexities of his life – from the triumphs of resisting encroaching settlers to the challenges of adapting to reservation life, all while advocating for his people's rights.
title: Red Cloud (Makhpiya-luta)
name: Red Cloud

description: Thayendanegea is a Mohawk military and political leader who allied with Great Britain during the American Revolution. He was known for his military skills and diplomatic abilities, and for his controversial role in the frontier wars.

mainEvents.description: Died in Burlington Beach, Upper Canada

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in early 19th century, after 1806 original seems to capture the moment when Thayendanegea, after a lifetime of war and diplomacy, is nearing the end of his life and reflects on the challenges and victories of his career.
title: Thayendanegea (Joseph Brant)
name: Thayendanegea

description: Thomas Jonathan Jackson is a Confederate general known for his military prowess, nicknamed "Stonewall" after the First Battle of Bull Run, and for his devout Presbyterian faith.

mainEvents.description: Died from pneumonia after being accidentally shot by Confederate troops

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1864 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Jonathan Jackson, despite his recent amputation, continued his military career, driven by his faith and commitment to the Confederacy, a stark contrast to the tragedies that were to follow.
title: Stonewall Jackson
name: Thomas Jonathan Jackson

description: Benjamin Strong is a prominent American banker who served as Governor of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York for fourteen years, leaving a lasting impact on American and global finance.

mainEvents.description: Became Governor of Federal Reserve Bank of New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1925 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin Strong, having navigated the turbulent years of World War I and the post-war financial crisis, stood at the helm of a resurgent US economy, his influence reaching far beyond national boundaries.
title: Benjamin Strong
name: Benjamin Strong

description: Thomas Corwin Mendenhall is a pioneering American physicist and meteorologist, known for his role in establishing Ohio State University's physics department, leading the U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey, and his groundbreaking work on stylometry, the analysis of writing style.

mainEvents.description: First physics professor at Ohio State University
Superintendent of the U.S. Coast and Geodetic Survey

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1918 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Corwin Mendenhall, at the twilight of his illustrious career, reflects on a life dedicated to advancing science, education, and the advancement of knowledge.
title: Thomas Corwin Mendenhall
name: Thomas Corwin Mendenhall

description: Herbert Clark Hoover is a prominent figure in American history, known for his roles as a mining engineer, humanitarian, and the 31st president of the United States. During his presidency, he faced the devastating Great Depression, and though his response was seen as inadequate, he also led many efforts towards economic recovery.

mainEvents.description: Became President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1921 seems to capture the moment when Hoover, a successful businessman and philanthropist, stood at the threshold of a political career that would culminate in the presidency. Having gained renown for his relief work during World War I, he was tapped to lead the Department of Commerce,  a role that would prove pivotal in shaping his political future and expose him to the intricacies of American government.
title: Herbert Hoover
name: Herbert Clark Hoover

description: Jacob Jennings Brown is a prominent American military figure who rose to the rank of general during the War of 1812.  He was instrumental in victories along the northern border, making him a national hero. Brown is also known for his contributions to military reorganization and education after the war.

mainEvents.description: Became Commanding General of the US Army
Fought in the Battle of Lundy's Lane
Defeated the British at the Battle of Sackets Harbor

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in after 1815 seems to capture the moment when Jacob Jennings Brown had achieved national fame for his victories in the War of 1812. Brown was appointed Commanding General of the United States Army in 1821 and held that post until his death. He initiated post-graduate education for staff and command officers, and the General Recruiting Service, to manage acquiring troops, and was highly respected in this role.
title: Jacob Jennings Brown
name: Jacob Jennings Brown

description: Collis Potter Huntington is a prominent American industrialist and railway magnate, known for his role in building the first transcontinental railroad and founding the Southern Pacific Railroad, as well as other major interstate lines. He is also recognized for his controversial political lobbying and his substantial contributions to art and philanthropy.

mainEvents.description: Founded Newport News Shipbuilding and Drydock Company
Died at Camp Pine Knot, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900 seems to capture the moment when Collis Potter Huntington, at the peak of his railroad empire, stood at the precipice of a new era of industrial development, having built one of the greatest transportation networks in the world, while facing public scrutiny for his ruthless business practices.
title: Collis Potter Huntington
name: Collis Potter Huntington

description: Benjamin O'Fallon is a prominent figure in the history of the American West, known for his role as an Indian agent, fur trader, and collector of Native American artifacts. He was instrumental in negotiations with Native American tribes, advocating for American traders and interests in the region. O'Fallon's life is intertwined with the westward expansion of the United States.

mainEvents.description: Appointed Indian Agent for upper Missouri River.
Lead peace commission up the Missouri River.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1833 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin O'Fallon, a seasoned Indian agent and fur trader, stands at the crossroads of his career. Having recently resigned his official position, he is now a successful businessman with a passion for Native American culture. The portrait reflects a man who has witnessed the westward expansion of the United States and the turbulent interactions between the Native American peoples and the white settlers, and whose life is deeply intertwined with the history of the American West.
title: Benjamin O'Fallon
name: Benjamin O'Fallon

description: Amerigo Vespucci is a prominent Italian explorer, navigator, and cartographer credited for discovering the Americas, or at least establishing their existence as a separate continent from Asia. While he was born in Florence, Italy, he spent most of his career navigating the Atlantic Ocean for Portugal and Spain.

mainEvents.description: Amerigo Vespucci was born in Florence, Italy
Vespucci went on his first voyage to the Americas
Vespucci set sail on his second voyage, discovering Brazil
Amerigo Vespucci was appointed as the chief pilot
Amerigo Vespucci passed away in Seville, Spain

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1816 seems to capture the moment when Amerigo Vespucci is contemplating the discoveries he made, especially his second voyage to Brazil, and the impact those voyages had on the world.
title: Amerigo Vespucci
name: Amerigo Vespucci

description: Thomas Stone is a prominent American Founding Father, lawyer, planter, and politician known for signing the Declaration of Independence and serving in the Continental Congress.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1785 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Stone was at the height of his political career, having served as a delegate to the Continental Congress, a member of the Maryland Senate, and President of Congress. It likely represents a time when he was working on the Articles of Confederation and grappling with the challenges of forming a new nation, while also facing the personal tragedy of his wife's declining health.
title: Thomas Stone
name: Thomas Stone

description: Charles Lee is a prominent lawyer and politician who served as the Attorney General of the United States during the presidencies of George Washington and John Adams. He is known for representing clients in important legal cases, such as the Marbury v. Madison case.  Lee was also a member of the Virginia House of Delegates and served as the acting Secretary of State.

mainEvents.description: Served as acting Secretary of State

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1810-11 seems to capture the moment when Charles Lee, well-established in the legal world, stands on the cusp of his career. He has already served as Attorney General, leaving that position to pursue legal practice, and has just entered the second phase of his life with his second marriage.
title: Charles Lee
name: Charles Lee

description: William Temple Hornaday is a prominent American zoologist, conservationist, and author who was a pioneer in early wildlife conservation in the United States, and served as the first director of the New York Zoological Park (the Bronx Zoo).

mainEvents.description: Appointed chief taxidermist of the US National Museum
Became director of the Bronx Zoo

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the early 1900s seems to capture the moment when Hornaday, already an established zoologist and conservationist, was deeply engaged in his lifelong mission to protect wildlife, particularly the American Bison, and establish the Bronx Zoo as a world-class institution.
title: William Temple Hornaday
name: William Temple Hornaday

description: John Laurens is a prominent figure in the American Revolution, known for his military service, his abolitionist views, and his close friendship with Alexander Hamilton. He fought bravely in many key battles, advocating for the inclusion of enslaved people in the fight for freedom. His life and ideals continue to inspire.

mainEvents.description: Fought at the Battle of Brandywine
Proposed the recruitment of a black regiment
Died in the Battle of the Combahee River

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1780 seems to capture the moment when John Laurens, a young lieutenant colonel, was at the height of his military career, having fought bravely in several battles. It was a time when he was actively promoting the recruitment of enslaved people as soldiers, a cause he passionately believed in, even in a society deeply divided on the issue.
title: John Laurens
name: John Laurens

description: Thomas Pinckney is a prominent figure in American history, serving as a military officer, diplomat, and statesman. He fought in the Revolutionary and War of 1812, served as governor of South Carolina, and as the U.S. minister to Great Britain. He also negotiated the Treaty of San Lorenzo, which defined the border between the United States and Spain.

mainEvents.description: Served as Governor of South Carolina
Served as U.S. Minister to Great Britain
Negotiated the Treaty of San Lorenzo

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1791 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Pinckney, having established his career in diplomacy, is on the cusp of a pivotal turning point in his life, entering the national political arena as a prominent figure in the Federalist Party.
title: Thomas Pinckney
name: Thomas Pinckney

description: Marquis de Lafayette is a French nobleman who served as a general in the American Revolutionary War and later a key figure in the French Revolution, known as 'The Hero of the Two Worlds'.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1822 seems to capture the moment when Lafayette, having achieved fame in both America and France, was approaching the twilight of his life, reflecting on a lifetime of service to liberty.
title: Marquis De Lafayette
name: Marquis de Lafayette

description: Joseph Eggleston Johnston is a prominent American military figure who served in both the United States Army and the Confederate States Army, rising to the rank of general in both forces. He's known for his strategic brilliance and for being one of the most senior Confederate officers in the Civil War.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1860-61 seems to capture the moment when Johnston was at the height of his career in the U.S. Army, on the cusp of the Civil War and just before his loyalties would be tested.
title: Joseph Eggleston Johnston
name: Joseph Eggleston Johnston

description: Lyman Beecher is a prominent Presbyterian minister, renowned for his staunch anti-Catholicism and fervent opposition to slavery, despite his initial support for colonization. He was a leading figure in the Second Great Awakening, a period of religious revivalism in the United States, and a prolific writer.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when Lyman Beecher, at the age of 67, was at the peak of his influence, having recently navigated the tumultuous Lane Seminary debates and emerged as a champion of abolitionism, even though his initial support for colonization and his controversial anti-Catholicism had previously made him a controversial figure.
title: Lyman Beecher
name: Lyman Beecher

description: Rev. John Carroll is a foundational figure in American Catholicism, serving as the first bishop and archbishop of Baltimore, establishing Georgetown University, and spearheading the church's organization in the newly formed United States.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1809 seems to capture the moment when Rev. John Carroll, now the first Archbishop of Baltimore, stands at the peak of his influence, having navigated the challenges of establishing the Catholic Church in the young nation and laid the groundwork for its future.
title: Reverend John Carroll
name: Rev. John Carroll

description: John Joseph Pershing is a highly decorated American military officer best known for leading the American Expeditionary Force during World War I.  He is the only person to be promoted to General of the Armies in his lifetime. He was nicknamed 'Black Jack'.

mainEvents.description: Promoted to General of the Armies

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1920-21 seems to capture the moment when John Joseph Pershing, having just led American forces to victory in World War I, is reaching the pinnacle of his career.  He is at the top of his game, a national hero, and his influence on the American military will continue for decades.
title: John Joseph Pershing
name: John Joseph Pershing

description: Samuel Francis Du Pont is a Rear Admiral in the United States Navy, a member of the prominent du Pont family who served in the Mexican-American War and the American Civil War, and was a vocal advocate for the modernization of the U.S. Navy.

mainEvents.description: Born at Goodstay, Bergen Point, New Jersey
Captured San Diego in the Mexican-American War
Led the South Atlantic Blockading Squadron in the Civil War
Controversially blamed for the failed attack on Charleston, South Carolina

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1867-68 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Francis Du Pont was reflecting on his controversial dismissal from the Union Navy and the legacy of his contributions to the American Civil War. It was a time when he was seeking to re-establish his position as a skilled and capable naval officer, despite the setbacks of his career. He also looked back on his work in the Navy, and how he had contributed to the modernization of the fleet. This portrait shows a man still proud of his accomplishments, but one who was aware of the challenges and uncertainties that lay ahead.
title: Samuel Francis Du Pont
name: Samuel Francis Du Pont

description: William Henry Aspinwall is a prominent American businessman, shipping magnate, and philanthropist who revolutionized trade and transportation to the Western Coast of the US by founding the Pacific Mail Steamship Company and the Panama Canal Railway. He was also involved in the Civil War, helping to stop the Confederate States from receiving vital warships from England.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1871 seems to capture the moment when Aspinwall, in his mid-sixties, is enjoying a period of relative calm after his decades of intense work as a shipping magnate and entrepreneur. The portrait was taken just five years before his death.  He had just retired from the business world and was enjoying his country estate near Tarrytown, New York. His major achievements, such as the founding of the Pacific Mail Steamship Company and the Panama Canal Railway, were behind him, but he was still active as a philanthropist.
title: William Henry Aspinwall
name: William Henry Aspinwall

description: James Jerome Hill is a Canadian-American railroad director and financier who built the Great Northern Railway across the U.S.  He was known as "The Empire Builder" and was instrumental in the development of the Upper Midwest.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1916 seems to capture the moment when James J. Hill was at the peak of his career, having built the Great Northern Railway and securing his position as a leading figure in American business and transportation.
title: James Jerome Hill
name: James Jerome Hill

description: Samuel Seabury is a prominent figure in American history, serving as the first American Episcopal bishop, the second Presiding Bishop of the Episcopal Church, and the first Bishop of Connecticut. He was a devoted Loyalist during the American Revolution and a controversial figure due to his writings against the Continental Congress, most famously against Alexander Hamilton.

mainEvents.description: Became rector of St James Church

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1785 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Seabury, having successfully navigated the complexities of obtaining episcopal consecration in Scotland, returned to Connecticut and established himself as the first American-born bishop. This period marks the beginning of his influence on the formation of the Episcopal Church in the United States, a role he would continue to play until his death.
title: Samuel Seabury
name: Samuel Seabury

description: Simon Newcomb is a Canadian-American polymath who was a leading astronomer, mathematician, and author. He made important contributions to astronomy, including the recalculation of astronomical constants, and wrote numerous popular science books and a science fiction novel.
