He is considered one of the most significant figures in the history of astronomy.

mainEvents.description: Became director of the Nautical Almanac Office

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1909 seems to capture the moment when Simon Newcomb, having established his reputation as a leading astronomer and mathematician, was nearing the end of his illustrious career. He had achieved numerous significant accomplishments, including the recalculation of astronomical constants, and was actively involved in scientific research and writing. This portrait reflects his contemplative nature, his profound understanding of the universe, and the impact he had on the scientific community.
title: Simon Newcomb
name: Simon Newcomb

description: Parke Godwin is a 19th-century American journalist known for his work on the Evening Post, his contributions to Fourierist thought, and his advocacy for free trade and abolitionism.

mainEvents.description: Married the daughter of William Cullen Bryant
Became an associate editor of Putnam's Magazine

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1880 seems to capture the moment when Parke Godwin, after a long and distinguished career in journalism, had become a respected voice in American politics and culture, known for his staunch abolitionist views and his contributions to the intellectual landscape of the time.
title: Parke Godwin
name: Parke Godwin

description: John Merven Carrère is a prominent Beaux-Arts architect, known for his collaboration with Thomas Hastings, and notable works like the New York Public Library and the Ponce de Leon Hotel.

mainEvents.description: Won New York Public Library commission

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1905 seems to capture the moment when John Merven Carrère was at the height of his success, having won the prestigious New York Public Library commission and firmly established his partnership with Thomas Hastings, just before the tragic car accident that would cut his life short.
title: John Merven Carrere
name: John Merven Carrere

description: Thomas Benedict Clarke is a prominent art collector who amassed a renowned collection of American art, particularly of the Hudson River School. He was also an art dealer and patron of the arts.

mainEvents.description: First art exhibition of his collection
Retired from linen business, became full-time art dealer
Bought Suffolk Hunt Club, East Hampton

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1884 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Benedict Clarke, already a prominent art collector, is transitioning into a full-time art dealer and a leading figure in the New York art world.
title: Thomas Benedict Clarke
name: Thomas Benedict Clarke

description: Luman Reed is a prominent American merchant and art patron who greatly influenced the development of American painting in the early 19th century. His support for artists like George Whiting Flagg and Thomas Cole significantly shaped the American art scene.

mainEvents.description: Born in Green River, New York
Commissioned works from Asher B. Durand

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1835 seems to capture the moment when Luman Reed, having established himself as a successful merchant and art collector, is actively promoting the growth of American art through his patronage of emerging artists like Durand.
title: Luman Reed
name: Luman Reed

description: James Pollard Espy is a pioneering American meteorologist who developed the convection theory of storms, explaining it in 1836 before the American Philosophical Society and in 1840 before the French Académie des Sciences and the British Royal Society. He was also the first meteorologist for the U.S. government.

mainEvents.description: Espy born in Westmorland County, PA

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849 seems to capture the moment when Espy, already a renowned meteorologist, was gaining recognition for his work, having recently been appointed the Navy Department meteorologist.
title: James Pollard Espy
name: James Pollard Espy

description: Sidney Dillon is a prominent American railroad executive and builder who played a pivotal role in the construction of the Union Pacific Railroad, a major part of the First Transcontinental Railroad. Known for his involvement in the Crédit Mobilier scandal, he was also a key figure in the rise of the Western Union Telegraph Company and served as president of the Union Pacific Railroad for two terms.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1889 seems to capture the moment when Sidney Dillon, after a long and successful career, has just stepped down from the presidency of the Union Pacific Railroad for the second time, contemplating his legacy as a pioneer of American railroading and facing the challenges of his later years.
title: Sidney Dillon
name: Sidney Dillon

description: George Fuller is a prominent 19th-century American painter known for his evocative portraits and figure paintings, often depicting rural life and Southern subjects. He was a member of the National Academy of Design and is recognized for his distinctive style, characterized by soft brushwork and a focus on capturing the essence of his subjects.

mainEvents.description: Joined the National Academy of Design
First art exhibition relaunched his career

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the late 1870s seems to capture the moment when Fuller's career was revitalized after a period of focusing on farming. His distinctive style had matured, reflecting his rich experiences in rural settings and travels through the Southern United States.
title: George Fuller
name: George Fuller

description: Joel Barlow is a prominent American poet, diplomat, and politician known for his epic poem "The Columbiad" and his support for the French Revolution. He also served as a diplomat to France and Algiers, where he helped negotiate the Treaty of Tripoli.

mainEvents.description: Served as American Consul in Algiers

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1806 seems to capture the moment when Joel Barlow, a veteran of the American Revolution and the French Revolution, was at the peak of his diplomatic career, having served as consul in Algiers and preparing for his pivotal role as U.S. minister to France.
title: Joel Barlow
name: Joel Barlow

description: William Cullen Bryant is a prominent American Romantic poet, journalist, and editor of the New York Evening Post, known for his accessible poetry, early advocacy for social justice, and impactful translation of Homer.

mainEvents.description: Became editor of the New-York Evening Post

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1865 seems to capture the moment when William Cullen Bryant, a seasoned editor and influential voice for social justice, stands on the cusp of translating Homer's epic poems, a testament to his enduring literary legacy.
title: William Cullen Bryant
name: William Cullen Bryant

description: Samuel Myer Isaacs is a Dutch-born American educator, philanthropist and rabbi, who was the second Jewish spiritual leader in the United States to teach in English.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in date unknown seems to capture the moment when Samuel Myer Isaacs, in his middle age, is at the peak of his career as a rabbi and advocate for the Jewish community, having founded the newspaper The Jewish Messenger, and many institutions like the United Hebrew Charities and the Jew's Hospital.
title: Samuel Myer Isaacs
name: Samuel Myer Isaacs

description: Washington Irving is a celebrated American author, known for his short stories, essays, biographies, and historical works.  His works, often humorous and romantic, captured the spirit of the American identity, with iconic stories like 'Rip Van Winkle' and 'The Legend of Sleepy Hollow'.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1840 seems to capture the moment when Washington Irving, having achieved international acclaim, was returning to America after a long residence in Europe, his reputation firmly established as a leading American man of letters, yet still in his prime as a writer and historian.
title: Washington Irving
name: Washington Irving

description: Richard Morris Hunt is a renowned American architect of the 19th century, best known for designing grand mansions like the Biltmore Estate and Newport's summer cottages, shaping the skyline of New York City with structures like the Metropolitan Museum of Art's Fifth Avenue entrance and the Statue of Liberty's pedestal, and for founding the first American architectural school.

mainEvents.description: Richard Morris Hunt founds the first American architectural school.
Richard Morris Hunt designs the Statue of Liberty pedestal.
Richard Morris Hunt designs the Biltmore Estate.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1849 seems to capture the moment when Richard Morris Hunt, a young man having studied in Europe, returns to America, eager to make his mark as an architect, just before he founded the first American architectural school.
title: Richard Morris Hunt
name: Richard Morris Hunt

description: William Trost Richards is a renowned American landscape painter of the 19th century, known for his meticulous realism and his association with both the Hudson River School and the American Pre-Raphaelite movement.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1890 seems to capture the moment when William Trost Richards, a seasoned artist at 57, was fully immersed in his later artistic phase, specializing in marine watercolors and  having established his legacy as a leading figure in American landscape art.
title: William Trost Richards
name: William Trost Richards

description: George Inness is a renowned American landscape painter known for his evocative landscapes and spiritual themes, particularly influenced by the Hudson River School and Barbizon School. He is considered a transitional figure in American art, blending realism and impressionism.

mainEvents.description: First European trip, studied in Rome
Elected to the National Academy of Design
Died in Bridge of Allan, Scotland

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1871 seems to capture the moment when George Inness, at the height of his mid-career, was already exploring the spiritual dimension in his art, while still showcasing the technical mastery honed through years of study and practice.
title: George Inness
name: George Inness

description: Catahecassa, also known as Black Hoof, was a prominent Shawnee chief who led his people through significant changes, including wars with American settlers, the adaptation to white culture, and ultimately the relocation of the Shawnee to the West. His leadership during a tumultuous period marked by conflict and negotiation defined his legacy.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1830-33 seems to capture the moment when Black Hoof, after years of resistance, had grudgingly accepted the United States' policy of assimilation and removal, a decision born from the realization that war was not a sustainable path for his people. It is a portrait of a leader grappling with the painful reality of change while seeking the best path for his tribe's survival.
title: Catahecassa
name: Catahecassa

description: John Bigelow is a prominent American lawyer, diplomat, and historian best known for his roles in securing the Union victory during the Civil War, founding the New York Public Library, and editing the complete works of Benjamin Franklin.

mainEvents.description: Served as US Minister to France
Founded the New York Public Library

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1901 seems to capture the moment when John Bigelow, nearing the twilight of his long and impactful life, stood as a testament to his unwavering commitment to public service, having shaped American history through his diplomatic efforts, his advocacy for social reform, and his dedication to preserving the nation's literary legacy.
title: John Bigelow
name: John Bigelow

description: Paul Wayland Bartlett is a renowned American sculptor known for his Beaux-Arts style and monumental works like 'The Apotheosis of Democracy' on the U.S. Capitol.

mainEvents.description: Studied in Paris under Emmanuel Frémiet.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1890 seems to capture the moment when Paul Wayland Bartlett, already a rising star in Paris, was establishing his reputation as a sculptor of classical grandeur, shortly before his major commission for the U.S. Capitol.
title: Paul Wayland Bartlett
name: Paul Wayland Bartlett

description: James Smithson is a British chemist and mineralogist known for founding the Smithsonian Institution, a renowned research complex in Washington, D.C., through his generous bequest.

mainEvents.description: Elected a Fellow of the Royal Society

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1816 seems to capture the moment when James Smithson was at the peak of his scientific career, having already established himself as a respected researcher and Fellow of the Royal Society. At 51, Smithson was a seasoned scientist and a prolific author, having contributed numerous papers to the Royal Society, including his groundbreaking work on the mineral calamine. The portrait reflects the intellectual energy and curiosity that would propel him to become a significant figure in the history of science.
title: James Smithson
name: James Smithson

description: John Quinn is a lawyer, art collector, and patron of modern art who fought to overturn censorship laws and promote modern art in the United States. He was a major figure in the Armory Show and a friend to prominent figures like Ezra Pound and T.S. Eliot.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1908 seems to capture the moment when John Quinn, a successful lawyer with a growing interest in modern art, was on the cusp of becoming a pivotal figure in the American art world, a champion for artistic freedom and a collector of masterpieces that would redefine artistic taste.
title: John Quinn
name: John Quinn

description: Cecilia Beaux is a renowned American portrait painter, recognized for her elegant and sensitive portrayals of prominent figures from the Gilded Age. Her works showcase a masterful technique and keen understanding of her subjects, earning her comparisons to John Singer Sargent.

mainEvents.description: Moved to Paris for art studies
First woman to teach at PAFA

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1889-94 seems to capture the moment when Cecilia Beaux, having returned to Philadelphia after her Parisian training, was beginning to establish herself as a leading portraitist of the American elite, her artistic talent recognized both at home and abroad.
title: Cecilia Beaux Self-Portrait
name: Cecilia Beaux

description: Charles Tyson Yerkes is a controversial American financier, known for his role in developing mass-transit systems in Chicago and London, using often dubious methods to achieve his goals.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1893 seems to capture the moment when Yerkes was at the peak of his influence in Chicago, having built a transport empire and establishing himself as a prominent art collector.  Yerkes had just secured the funding for the Yerkes Observatory and was about to begin his ambitious campaign for control of the London Underground.
title: Charles Tyson Yerkes
name: Charles Tyson Yerkes

description: Daniel Boone is a renowned American frontiersman, explorer, and folk hero best known for his role in the westward expansion and settlement of Kentucky.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1820 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Boone, an aging veteran of the frontier, reflects on a life filled with adventure and hardship, a pioneer who helped shape the American West.
title: Daniel Boone
name: Daniel Boone

description: George Washington is a Founding Father of the United States, military officer, farmer, and the first President, remembered for his leadership in the American Revolution and establishing precedents for the Presidency.

mainEvents.description: Commander in Chief of the Continental Army

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1853 seems to capture the moment when George Washington, in his later years, reflects on the tumultuous era of revolution and founding he helped guide.
title: George Washington (Porthole type)
name: George Washington

description: Yehudi Menuhin is a renowned American-born British violinist and conductor, acclaimed as one of the greatest violinists of the 20th century, known for his virtuosity, humanitarian work, and founding of music schools.

mainEvents.description: Played for survivors of concentration camps

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1932 seems to capture the moment when Yehudi Menuhin, already a celebrated violinist, was on the cusp of a groundbreaking career, having just recorded Elgar's Violin Concerto with the composer himself.
title: Yehudi Menuhin
name: Yehudi Menuhin

description: Samuel Finley Breese Morse is a renowned American inventor and painter best known for his invention of the single-wire telegraph system, which revolutionized long-distance communication. He also developed Morse code, a standardized system for transmitting messages, and played a significant role in the commercial adoption of telegraphy. During his early career, Morse established himself as a talented portrait painter, creating iconic works of prominent figures such as John Adams and Marquis de Lafayette.

mainEvents.description: Morse was born in Charlestown, Massachusetts.
Morse received his patent for the telegraph.
Morse died in New York City.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1812 seems to capture the moment when Morse was a young, ambitious artist, seeking to establish himself as a painter. He had recently graduated from Yale College and was embarking on a career that would later transition into a life-changing invention.
title: Samuel F. B. Morse Self-Portrait
name: Samuel Finley Breese Morse

description: George Washington is a Founding Father of the United States, military officer, and farmer who served as the first president. He led the Continental Army to victory in the Revolutionary War and presided over the Constitutional Convention. He set enduring precedents for the U.S. presidency, including the two-term tradition.

mainEvents.description: First president of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1795 seems to capture the moment when George Washington, in his early sixties, had successfully steered the nation through its first years of independence, establishing a stable republic and facing down threats to its unity.
title: George Washington
name: George Washington

description: Charles Carroll Glover is a prominent American banker and philanthropist, best known for his significant contributions to the development of Washington, D.C.'s parks and monuments.

mainEvents.description: Birth in Macon County, North Carolina

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1900 seems to capture the moment when Charles Carroll Glover, a man of both business acumen and civic passion, was at the height of his influence in shaping the landscape of Washington, D.C., having already played a pivotal role in the creation of Rock Creek Park and Potomac Park, and poised to make his mark on the National Cathedral.
title: Charles Carroll Glover
name: Charles Carroll Glover

description: Maud Powell is a renowned American violinist who achieved international acclaim for her skill and virtuosity.  She was a powerful advocate for music by Americans, women, and Black composers, including commissioning a violin concerto from Samuel Coleridge-Taylor, and championed the Sibelius Violin Concerto.

mainEvents.description: First American performances of Tchaikovsky and Sibelius violin concertos
Suffered a heart attack on stage
Died from a heart attack while on tour

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1918 or 1919 seems to capture the moment when Maud Powell, having achieved international acclaim, was nearing the peak of her career, perhaps  already sensing the tragedy that was about to befall her.
title: Maud Powell
name: Maud Powell

description: Junius Brutus Booth is a renowned English-born American actor of the 19th century, best known for his dramatic roles in Shakespearean plays. Booth's performances were known for their intensity and passion, often transcending the boundaries of conventional acting, leaving a lasting impact on the American theatre.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1823 seems to capture the moment when Junius Brutus Booth's career began to blossom in America. Having recently emigrated, he had already gained acclaim for his powerful performances, bringing a new style of acting to the American stage, setting the stage for his future success.
title: Junius Brutus Booth as Sir Edward Mortimer
name: Junius Brutus Booth

description: Robert Edward Lee is a renowned Confederate general known for his strategic brilliance and leadership during the American Civil War. He commanded the Army of Northern Virginia, achieving notable victories but ultimately surrendering at Appomattox Court House. Lee's legacy remains complex, reflecting his military skills, controversial stances on slavery, and enduring influence on Southern identity.

mainEvents.description: Graduated second in his class from West Point
Took command of the Army of Northern Virginia

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1864-65 seems to capture the moment when Robert E. Lee, now a seasoned veteran, was fighting a desperate war with dwindling resources and facing increasing pressure from the relentless Union advance.
title: Robert E. Lee
name: Robert Edward Lee

description: James Fenimore Cooper is a celebrated American novelist known for his historical romances, particularly "The Last of the Mohicans", and for his sea stories. He was a strong advocate for American culture and a critic of European society.

mainEvents.description: Published "The Spy", his first major success
Published "The Last of the Mohicans", his most famous work

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1860 seems to capture the moment when James Fenimore Cooper, nearing the end of his long and illustrious career, reflects on a life spent writing about the American frontier and the sea, both of which he deeply loved.
title: James Fenimore Cooper
name: James Fenimore Cooper

description: Eleazar Parmly is a prominent American dentist known for establishing the first dental school in the US, the University of Maryland School of Dentistry, and for transforming dentistry from a craft to a respected profession.

mainEvents.description: Established first dental school in the US

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1835 seems to capture the moment when Eleazar Parmly, having gained international experience and opened his dental shop in New York City, was on the cusp of his significant contributions to the profession, including founding the first dental school in the US.
title: Eleazer Parmly
name: Eleazar Parmly

description: Henry James is a prolific American-British author, known for his complex psychological novels that explored the social interactions between émigré Americans and Europeans. His works, like 'The Portrait of a Lady',  are considered transitional between realism and modernism, and he is considered one of the greatest novelists in the English language.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900 seems to capture the moment when Henry James, at the pinnacle of his career, is transitioning from his earlier, more realistic style to the complex, introspective prose that would define his later works. He had already established himself as a leading voice in American literature, but his exploration of the human psyche, influenced by European writers like Zola, was just beginning to take shape.
title: Henry James
name: Henry James

description: William Collins Whitney is a prominent American political leader and financier, best known for his service as Secretary of the Navy in the first Grover Cleveland administration. He is remembered for modernizing the Navy, leading the development of the "New Navy", and his significant contributions to thoroughbred horse racing.

mainEvents.description: Served as Secretary of the Navy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in late 19th century seems to capture the moment when William Collins Whitney, a rising star in Democratic politics, was at the height of his influence, having just left his impactful term as Secretary of the Navy, and poised to leave his mark on both the political and business landscape of the nation.
title: William Collins Whitney
name: William Collins Whitney

description: Henry Cruger is a prominent figure of the late 18th century who served as a member of both the British Parliament and the New York State Senate. He was a wealthy merchant who navigated the tumultuous political landscape of the American Revolution and its aftermath.

mainEvents.description: Henry Cruger is elected to the British Parliament.
Henry Cruger is elected to the New York State Senate.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1770 seems to capture the moment when Henry Cruger was at the height of his mercantile success in Bristol, England, having built a fortune despite the disruption of the Stamp Act. He was a prominent figure in Bristol's political and social circles, foreshadowing his future political career.
title: Henry Cruger
name: Henry Cruger

description: Montgomery Blair is a prominent figure in American political history, serving as Postmaster General during the Civil War under President Lincoln. He was a lawyer, politician, and a strong advocate for Unionist causes. Blair played a significant role in the formation of the Republican Party and his political career was closely intertwined with his family's prominence in the Democratic Party.

mainEvents.description: Montgomery Blair graduates from West Point
Montgomery Blair begins his term as Postmaster General
Montgomery Blair resigns as Postmaster General

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1968, after 1845 original seems to capture the moment when Blair's political career was transitioning from staunch Unionist to a more focused advocate for the post-war South, a period of intense debate and reconstruction.
title: Montgomery Blair
name: Montgomery Blair

description: Samuel Jones Tilden is a prominent American politician, lawyer, and reformer who served as the 25th Governor of New York and was the Democratic nominee for President in the disputed 1876 election. He was a prominent figure in the fight against corruption and was known for his sharp legal mind and shrewd financial acumen.

mainEvents.description: Born in New Lebanon, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1870 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Jones Tilden, having established himself as a leading legal mind and successful reformer, stands on the precipice of national prominence. His victory over Tammany Hall and his success as Governor of New York made him a formidable force in national politics, ultimately leading to his nomination for President in 1876.
title: Samuel Jones Tilden
name: Samuel Jones Tilden

description: James Wilkinson is a controversial figure in American history, serving as a soldier, politician, and a double agent for Spain. He is known for his involvement in the Burr conspiracy and his controversial military career.

mainEvents.description: Served in the Continental Army during the American Revolution
Appointed first Governor of Louisiana Territory
Testified against Aaron Burr in the Burr Conspiracy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1820 seems to capture the moment when James Wilkinson, facing public scrutiny and disillusionment after the Burr conspiracy, contemplated his legacy,  a life marked by ambition, betrayal, and the enduring mystery of his double life.
title: James Wilkinson
name: James Wilkinson

description: Jean Baptiste Donatien de Vimeur Rochambeau is a French military leader and nobleman who played a crucial role in the American Revolutionary War, leading French forces to victory at the Siege of Yorktown.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1782 seems to capture the moment when Rochambeau, at the height of his military career, had just achieved a decisive victory at Yorktown, forever cementing his place in American history.
title: Jean Baptiste de Rochambeau
name: Jean Baptiste Donatien de Vimeur Rochambeau

description: John Adolphus Bernard Dahlgren is a pioneering American naval officer who revolutionized naval ordnance during the 19th century. He is best known for designing the Dahlgren gun, a powerful muzzle-loading cannon that became the standard armament of the U.S. Navy, and for founding the Ordnance Department.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1945 seems to capture the moment when Dahlgren, having achieved his lifetime's work, was in his later years, reflecting on a career that had reshaped the U.S. Navy.
title: John Adolphus Bernard Dahlgren
name: John Adolphus Bernard Dahlgren

description: Stephen Decatur Jr. is a legendary American naval officer who distinguished himself in the Quasi-War, the Barbary Wars, and the War of 1812. He became a national hero for his daring exploits and courage. He was also known for his charisma and leadership.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1820 seems to capture the moment when Decatur, already a celebrated hero from the First Barbary War, had recently returned from a successful campaign against the Barbary pirates in the Second Barbary War. He had risen to the rank of Commodore and was at the height of his fame and influence.
title: Stephen Decatur
name: Stephen Decatur Jr.

description: Benjamin Tappan is a prominent figure in Ohio's history, serving as a judge, senator, and early settler. A lawyer, military officer, and politician, he played a key role in shaping the state's legal system and its development.

mainEvents.description: Censured by Senate for breach of confidence

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1839 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin Tappan, in the prime of his political career, is a seasoned statesman, having served as a federal judge, senator, and a key figure in the development of Ohio.
title: Benjamin Tappan
name: Benjamin Tappan

description: John Marshall is a prominent figure in American history, best known as the fourth Chief Justice of the United States, shaping the nation's legal system and strengthening the federal government.

mainEvents.description: Authored the Life of George Washington

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in after 1831 seems to capture the moment when John Marshall, a staunch Federalist, was in the twilight of his career, having solidified the Supreme Court's power of judicial review and shaped the nation's understanding of the Constitution.
title: John Marshall
name: John Marshall

description: William Austin Burt is a key figure in the development of the American Midwest, known for his surveying inventions and discoveries, including the solar compass and significant iron ore deposits.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1845 seems to capture the moment when William Austin Burt was on the cusp of his greatest contributions to American surveying, having already invented the solar compass and shortly before his discovery of the Marquette Iron Range, a turning point in Michigan's economic history.
title: William Austin Burt
name: William Austin Burt

description: John Paul Jones is a Scottish-born American naval officer, known as the "Father of the American Navy."  His exploits during the American Revolutionary War earned him international renown, particularly his daring raid on Whitehaven and the Battle of Flamborough Head where he famously exclaimed "I have not yet begun to fight!"
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1780 seems to capture the moment when John Paul Jones was at the peak of his naval career. He had just completed his daring campaign in the North Sea, including the Battle of Flamborough Head, and had earned a reputation as a formidable naval commander, both in America and abroad. Despite his success, the portrait reflects a hint of weariness, hinting at the future challenges that would lie ahead, including his contentious time in the Russian Navy and the accusations that would ultimately lead to his exile and death.
title: John Paul Jones
name: John Paul Jones

description: David Glasgow Farragut is a renowned United States Navy admiral, known for his decisive victories during the Civil War, including the capture of New Orleans and the Battle of Mobile Bay, where he famously uttered the order 'Damn the torpedoes... full speed ahead!'

mainEvents.description: Joined the Navy as a midshipman

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1838 seems to capture the moment when Farragut, having risen through the ranks in the Navy, was establishing a reputation for bravery and competence, preparing for the challenges of the Civil War that would solidify his legacy as a national hero.
title: David Glasgow Farragut
name: David Glasgow Farragut

description: Robley Dunglison Evans is a prominent U.S. Navy rear admiral, known for his distinguished service during the Civil War and Spanish-American War. He commanded the Great White Fleet on its historic voyage around the world in 1907-1908, and earned the nickname "Fighting Bob" for his courage and determination.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1909 seems to capture the moment when Robley Dunglison Evans, at the peak of his illustrious career, reflected upon his remarkable journey from a young midshipman during the Civil War to a renowned admiral leading the Great White Fleet, a symbol of American naval might.
title: Robley Dunglison Evans
name: Robley Dunglison Evans

description: Lewis Malone Ayer Jr. is a South Carolina politician who served as a Confederate Congressman during the American Civil War. He was born in 1821, served in the state legislature, and was a strong advocate for states' rights.

mainEvents.description: Elected to South Carolina State Legislature

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1838-45 seems to capture the moment when Lewis Malone Ayer Jr. was a young, ambitious lawyer, perhaps already involved in politics, his future bright with promise.
title: Lewis Malone Ayer, Jr.
name: Lewis Malone Ayer Jr.

description: Arthur St. Clair is a Scottish-born American military officer and politician who rose to prominence during the American Revolutionary War and served as the first governor of the Northwest Territory.

mainEvents.description: Served in the British Army during the French and Indian War
Fought in the American Revolutionary War
Appointed Governor of the Northwest Territory

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1795 seems to capture the moment when Arthur St. Clair, a seasoned veteran and newly appointed governor, is navigating the challenges of establishing the Northwest Territory, a vast and untamed frontier, while grappling with the aftermath of St. Clair's Defeat, a devastating loss he suffered in the Northwest Indian War.
title: Arthur St. Claire
name: Arthur St. Clair

description: Daniel Morgan is a celebrated American Revolutionary War hero, known for his strategic brilliance and leadership, especially in the Battle of Cowpens. He later served as a US Congressman and helped suppress the Whiskey Rebellion.

mainEvents.description: Served in Benedict Arnold's Expedition to Quebec
Helped to suppress the Whiskey Rebellion

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1780 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Morgan is on the cusp of his greatest military achievement, having already proven himself a formidable leader in the Revolutionary War and about to lead his men to victory in the Battle of Cowpens, securing a turning point in the Southern Campaign.
title: Daniel Morgan
name: Daniel Morgan

description: Daniel Boone is a legendary American frontiersman known for his exploration and settlement of Kentucky. He was a skilled hunter, surveyor, and militia officer, and played a significant role in the American Revolution.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1820 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Boone, an elderly frontiersman, reflects on a lifetime of adventure and hardship, a life spent navigating the wild frontier and carving out a place for his family and his nation.
title: Daniel Boone
name: Daniel Boone

description: Edward Maynard is a prominent American dentist and firearms inventor, best known for his breechloading rifle design and the Maynard priming system, which revolutionized early firearms technology.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1881 seems to capture the moment when Edward Maynard, a man of significant influence in both dentistry and firearms innovation, is reflecting on his long and successful career.  His numerous patents, including the Maynard priming system, had impacted the development of firearms, while his dentistry practice had earned him renown among the elite of Washington, D.C.
title: Edward Maynard
name: Edward Maynard

description: John Sergeant is a prominent American politician who served as a member of the House of Representatives and as Henry Clay's running mate in the 1832 presidential election.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1811 seems to capture the moment when John Sergeant was in his early 30s, before his rise to national prominence and a decade before his foray into national politics, a time marked by his successful legal practice and service in Pennsylvania state government.
title: John Sergeant
name: John Sergeant

description: Henry Williams Blodgett is a prominent American judge, politician, and lawyer best known for his service as a federal judge in the Northern District of Illinois, representing the state in both the House of Representatives and Senate, and for his successful legal career.

mainEvents.description: Elected to Illinois House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1875 seems to capture the moment when Henry Williams Blodgett, a seasoned lawyer and a rising political star, had already established himself as a prominent figure in Illinois politics, just before his appointment to the Federal bench, a position he held for over two decades.
title: Henry Williams Blodgett
name: Henry Williams Blodgett

description: John Marshall is a pivotal figure in American legal history, serving as the longest-serving Chief Justice of the United States and a key architect of the nation's judicial system. He established the principle of judicial review, strengthening the federal government and shaping the legal landscape for generations to come.

mainEvents.description: Marshall served in the Continental Army.
John Marshall was appointed Chief Justice of the United States.
The Marshall Court ruled in Marbury v. Madison.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1832 seems to capture the moment when John Marshall, at the height of his power and influence, had cemented the Supreme Court's position as an equal branch of government. His legacy is evident in the many decisions that established the supremacy of the federal government and the Constitution.
title: John Marshall
name: John Marshall

description: Samuel Chase is a Founding Father of the United States, a signer of the Declaration of Independence, and a Supreme Court Justice who was later impeached by the House of Representatives, though ultimately acquitted by the Senate.

mainEvents.description: Impeached by the House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1811 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Chase, at the age of 70, stood as a seasoned figure in American history, his career filled with controversy and defiance. He had been a leading figure in the Revolution, a fierce advocate for independence, and later a respected, yet sometimes controversial, jurist.
title: Samuel Chase
name: Samuel Chase

description: William Cullen Bryant is a prominent American Romantic poet, journalist, and editor known for his nature-themed poetry, particularly "Thanatopsis." He was a vocal advocate for social justice and was influential in shaping early American literature and journalism.

mainEvents.description: Began editing the New-York Evening Post

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1866 seems to capture the moment when William Cullen Bryant, at the pinnacle of his career,  still actively championed social causes and remained a prominent voice in New York City's literary and journalistic circles.
title: William Cullen Bryant
name: William Cullen Bryant

description: John Quinn is a prominent Irish-American lawyer and art collector who championed modern art and literature in the United States, fighting censorship and fostering cultural exchange.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1908 seems to capture the moment when John Quinn was a rising force in the American art scene, having begun to amass a significant collection of modern European paintings, but before he would achieve international renown for his role in the Armory Show and his legal battles against censorship.
title: John Quinn
name: John Quinn

description: Orestes Augustus Brownson is a noted American intellectual and activist, preacher, labor organizer, and writer who converted to Roman Catholicism.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Brownson, a staunch defender of the Union during the Civil War, had recently published his most important book, "The American Republic," and was still an active Catholic writer.
title: Orestes Brownson
name: Orestes Augustus Brownson

description: Mary Newton Foote Henderson is a prominent American author, real estate developer, and social activist from New York known as "The Empress of Sixteenth Street." She was a champion of women's suffrage, temperance, and vegetarianism. She also designed and built many grand homes on Sixteenth Street in Washington D.C.

mainEvents.description: Born in Seneca Falls, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1895 seems to capture the moment when Mary Newton Foote Henderson had achieved great wealth and was starting to implement her ambitious vision for the development of Meridian Hill, Washington D.C., which would later become Malcolm X Park.
title: Mary Henderson
name: Mary Newton Foote Henderson

description: Charles Herbert Woodbury is a renowned American marine painter known for his dynamic compositions of the coast and sea, particularly his captivating depictions of Ogunquit, Maine.

mainEvents.description: Elected full member of National Academy of Design

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1921 seems to capture the moment when Charles Herbert Woodbury was at the peak of his artistic career, having established himself as a master of marine painting and a highly sought-after teacher, leaving behind his grief from the death of his wife, Marcia Oakes, in 1913. His accomplishments are reflected in his vibrant brushstrokes, a testament to his enduring passion and skill.
title: Charles Herbert Woodbury
name: Charles Herbert Woodbury

description: Benjamin B. Lindsey is a pioneering American judge and social reformer, known for establishing the juvenile court system in Denver, Colorado, during the Progressive Era. He championed children's rights and advocated for social justice through his work in juvenile courts and his writings, including "The Beast," a critique of juvenile delinquency. Lindsey's legacy continues to influence modern juvenile justice systems.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1940 seems to capture the moment when Benjamin B. Lindsey, a champion for children's rights and social reform, was in the twilight of his career, a time when he faced significant challenges and controversy for his progressive views on companionate marriage, and was grappling with his legal battles. He stands as a testament to his enduring commitment to justice, even in the face of adversity.
title: Ben Lindsey
name: Benjamin B. Lindsey

description: John Lothrop Motley is a renowned American historian and diplomat, best known for his monumental works on the Dutch Republic.  He served as Minister to Austria and Great Britain, playing a key role in preventing European intervention in the American Civil War.  Known for his vivid, dramatic prose, he also wrote novels, but is primarily remembered for his meticulous historical scholarship.

mainEvents.description: Served as U.S. Minister to Great Britain

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1835 seems to capture the moment when John Lothrop Motley, a young man of promise, stands on the cusp of a brilliant career, a career that would see him become a prominent historian, a diplomat, and a champion of his nation's ideals.
title: John Lothrop Motley
name: John Lothrop Motley

description: Joel Barlow is a prominent figure in American history known for his literary contributions, diplomatic efforts, and political activism. His writings, such as "The Hasty-Pudding" and "The Columbiad," cemented his literary reputation while his diplomatic roles during the American Revolution and his service as U.S. Minister to France earned him respect in the political sphere.

mainEvents.description: Served as U.S. Minister to France

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1805 seems to capture the moment when Joel Barlow, having recently returned to the United States after years abroad, was at the height of his literary career, having published "The Columbiad." He was a man of letters, a diplomat, and a politician, all rolled into one, on the cusp of a new chapter in his life as he resumed his diplomatic duties as U.S. Minister to France.
title: Joel Barlow
name: Joel Barlow

description: Isaac Lea is a renowned American publisher, conchologist, and geologist whose contributions to science, publishing, and his notable discovery of fossilized footprints in Mount Carbon, Pennsylvania, earned him a lasting place in history.

mainEvents.description: Discovered fossilized footprints in Mount Carbon, Pennsylvania

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1884-85 seems to capture the moment when Isaac Lea, a seasoned scientist and businessman, had established his legacy. He had retired from his successful publishing career and dedicated his life to research and publishing scientific works.  His discovery of fossilized footprints had sparked a scientific controversy, and he had already experienced both praise and criticism for his findings. This portrait depicts a man confident in his convictions, reflecting on the rich tapestry of his life, and perhaps anticipating the continued debate surrounding his remarkable discovery.
title: Isaac Lea
name: Isaac Lea

description: David Wiley is a prominent figure in early American history, serving as a Presbyterian minister, surveyor, politician, writer, and scientist. He was instrumental in the development of Georgetown, District of Columbia, serving as postmaster and mayor.

mainEvents.description: Moved to Georgetown to lead Columbian Academy
Elected as the first editor of the Agricultural Museum

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1801 seems to capture the moment when David Wiley, a young man of 33, had just begun his prominent role in Georgetown, having been recently appointed as the headmaster of Columbian Academy. His intelligent gaze and poised demeanor hint at the intellectual pursuits and leadership he would soon exhibit in his role as a minister, scientist, and politician.
title: David Wiley
name: David Wiley

description: Charles William Eliot is a renowned American academic who served as the 21st President of Harvard University from 1869 to 1909,  transforming it from a provincial college into a prominent research university. He is known for his leadership in educational reform and the implementation of the elective system, which allowed students to select their courses.

mainEvents.description: Eliot became President of Harvard University
Eliot retired as President of Harvard University

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1923 seems to capture the moment when Charles William Eliot, having retired from the presidency of Harvard University in 1909,  still held the wisdom and gravitas earned from a lifetime of academic leadership and the vision of the future of higher education that he had so profoundly shaped.
title: Charles William Eliot
name: Charles William Eliot

description: Rev. Justus Henry Christian Helmuth is a German-American Lutheran clergyman, known for his theological teachings, founding Lutheran institutions, and fostering German-American cultural connections.

mainEvents.description: Moved to Philadelphia and became Pastor of St. Michael's Church

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1795 seems to capture the moment when Rev. Helmuth, a young, energetic, and newly arrived immigrant, is on the cusp of a significant career in America, having recently become Pastor of the first Lutheran congregation in Philadelphia. He is at the beginning of establishing a legacy that will shape the future of Lutheranism in the United States.
title: Reverend Justus Henry Christian Helmuth
name: Rev. Justus Henry Christian Helmuth

description: William Cullen Bryant is a prominent American Romantic poet, journalist, and editor who is best known for his iconic poem "Thanatopsis" and his long tenure as the editor of the New York Evening Post.

mainEvents.description: Became editor of the New York Evening Post

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in date unknown seems to capture the moment when William Cullen Bryant, already a celebrated poet and editor, stands at the height of his career, having established himself as a leading voice in American literature and journalism.
title: William Cullen Bryant
name: William Cullen Bryant

description: William Wilson Corcoran is a prominent American banker, philanthropist, and art collector, best known for founding the Corcoran Gallery of Art, which showcased American art and culture in the late 19th century.

mainEvents.description: Corcoran established his brokerage firm on Pennsylvania Avenue.
Corcoran founded the Corcoran Gallery of Art.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1884 seems to capture the moment when William Wilson Corcoran had reached the pinnacle of his success, having retired from banking to dedicate his wealth and energy to art and philanthropy, leaving a lasting legacy with the Corcoran Gallery of Art.
title: William Wilson Corcoran
name: William Wilson Corcoran

description: David Edward Finley is a prominent American cultural leader who played a pivotal role in shaping the nation's art and historic preservation landscape.

mainEvents.description: Became director of the National Gallery
Founded the National Trust for Historic Preservation
Led the Roberts Commission during WWII

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1950s seems to capture the moment when Finley, having successfully established the National Gallery of Art, is about to embark on his legacy of creating the National Portrait Gallery and leading the National Trust for Historic Preservation.
title: David E. Finley
name: David Edward Finley

description: Samuel Putnam Avery is a prominent American art connoisseur, dealer, and collector known for his significant contributions to art institutions like the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Columbia University.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1863 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Putnam Avery, a rising figure in the art world, was at the cusp of his successful art dealing career, shortly before he became a commissioner at the Exposition Universelle in Paris.
title: Samuel Putnam Avery
name: Samuel Putnam Avery

description: Rembrandt Peale is a prominent American artist known for his realistic portraits, especially of George Washington and Thomas Jefferson. He was a pioneer of museum exhibitions and a prolific painter throughout his long career.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1818 seems to capture the moment when Rembrandt Peale, after a decade of successful portraiture, had begun to establish his reputation as a leading American artist. title: Rembrandt Peale
name: Rembrandt Peale

description: Julius Bien is a German-born American lithographer, known for his technically superior work, including an edition of John James Audubon's 'Birds of America', and for being a prominent figure in the Jewish community as President of B'nai B'rith.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1886 seems to capture the moment when Julius Bien, a respected lithographer and businessman, was at the peak of his career, having established a successful studio and contributed to the groundbreaking 'Birds of America' project, while serving as President of B'nai B'rith.
title: Julius Bien
name: Julius Bien

description: Joel Chandler Harris is a renowned American journalist and folklorist, best known for his collection of Uncle Remus stories, which preserve African-American oral traditions, notably the tales of Brer Rabbit.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1914 seems to capture the moment when Joel Chandler Harris, at the height of his literary fame, was enjoying the fruits of his success, having retired from his long and storied career at The Atlanta Constitution, and continuing to write and publish, including the immensely popular Uncle Remus stories, which were translated into dozens of languages and were embraced by readers across the globe.

name: Joel Chandler Harris

description: James Abbott McNeill Whistler is a renowned American painter, printmaker, and aesthetic theorist who revolutionized the art world with his innovative techniques and controversial artistic philosophy.

description: John Jay Chapman is a prominent American writer and essayist known for his sharp critiques of American society and politics in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: John Jay Chapman
name: John Jay Chapman

description: Samuel Langhorne Clemens is a celebrated American author and humorist known by his pen name Mark Twain. Twain was a social critic and a prominent figure in American literature.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1912 or 1913 seems to capture the moment when Twain, despite his financial setbacks and personal tragedies,  continued to write and lecture, solidifying his position as a literary giant and a prominent social critic.
title: Samuel L. Clemens (Mark Twain)
name: Samuel Langhorne Clemens

description: George Frederick Bristow is a prominent American composer of the 19th century, known for championing American classical music over European works and composing "The Oratorio of Daniel," a significant work in the American musical repertoire.

title: George Frederick Bristow
name: George Frederick Bristow

description: Martha Washington is a pivotal figure in American history, known as the first First Lady of the United States, whose life spanned the American Revolution and the early years of the republic.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in early-mid 19th century seems to capture the moment when Martha Washington, a widow after the death of her husband George, reflected on her life as a prominent figure in the American Revolution and as a First Lady, leaving a lasting impact on the role of the president's wife.
title: Martha Washington
name: Martha Washington

description: Bayard Taylor is a prolific American writer who gained recognition as a poet, travel writer, translator, and diplomat. He was a popular figure, especially for his travelogues and his acclaimed translation of Goethe's Faust. He also served as a diplomat in Russia and Prussia.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1855 seems to capture the moment when Bayard Taylor, having already published successful travelogues like 'El Dorado' and 'A Journey to Central Africa,' was on the cusp of a new adventure – his journey to India, China, and Japan, which would later be recounted in his book 'A Visit to India, China, and Japan in the Year 1853' and further solidify his reputation as a leading travel writer.
title: Bayard Taylor
name: Bayard Taylor

description: Ulysses Simpson Grant is a prominent American figure known for his military leadership during the Civil War and his presidency, where he oversaw Reconstruction and pursued an ambitious peace policy for Native Americans.

mainEvents.description: Elected 18th president of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1869 seems to capture the moment when Ulysses S. Grant, at the peak of his military career, prepares to take on the challenging task of leading the nation through Reconstruction, his presidency marked by its successes and controversies.
title: Ulysses S. Grant
name: Ulysses Simpson Grant

description: Bushrod Washington is a prominent American attorney and politician who served as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court from 1798 to 1829, known for his unwavering support of Chief Justice John Marshall and his role as president of the American Colonization Society.

Bushrod Washington co-founded the American Colonization Society.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1828 seems to capture the moment when Bushrod Washington, nearing the end of his legal career, stood as a pillar of the nation's judicial system, a prominent figure in the American Colonization Society, and the steward of his uncle's legacy, Mount Vernon.
title: Bushrod Washington
name: Bushrod Washington

description: Joseph Stalin is a Georgian-born revolutionary and dictator, known for his brutal rule and industrialization of the Soviet Union. He is also responsible for the deaths of millions during the Great Purge and the Holodomor famine.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Stalin, at the height of his power, was consolidating his control over the Soviet Union through the Great Purge, a campaign of repression and violence that targeted his political opponents and anyone deemed a threat to his rule.
title: Joseph Stalin
name: Joseph Stalin

description: Reza Shah Pahlavi is a significant Iranian military officer and the founder of the Pahlavi dynasty, known for his modernization efforts and controversial social reforms.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1938 seems to capture the moment when Reza Shah, having consolidated his power, is at the peak of his modernization drive, implementing ambitious reforms across Iran, forging a new national identity.
title: Reza Shah Pahlavi
name: Reza Shah Pahlavi

description: Patience Lovell Wright is a pioneering American sculptor known for her life-sized wax figures, considered the first recognized American-born sculptor.

mainEvents.description: Born in Oyster Bay, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1782 seems to capture the moment when Patience Wright, having established herself in London society, is enjoying the height of her success, having created wax figures of nobility and royalty, and having become known for her unconventional persona.
title: Patience Lovell Wright
name: Patience Lovell Wright

description: Philip Henry Sheridan is a Union general in the American Civil War who rose from captain to major general in six months. He led Union cavalry in the Shenandoah Valley and pursued Gen. Robert E. Lee's army during the Appomattox Campaign, playing a key role in forcing Lee's surrender. Sheridan is also known for his controversial tactics in the Indian Wars.

Forced Robert E. Lee's surrender at Appomattox

The portrait may also reflect the political turmoil surrounding his actions in the Reconstruction Era, and his future role in the Indian Wars.

description: Frederick Douglass is a prominent abolitionist, orator, and writer who escaped slavery and became a leading voice for civil rights in the 19th century. He wrote influential autobiographies and founded the abolitionist newspaper, the North Star.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1845 seems to capture the moment when Frederick Douglass was gaining national recognition for his powerful words and compelling story, a testament to his courage and intellect, just three years after publishing his first autobiography.

name: Frederick Douglass

description: James Buchanan Duke is a prominent American industrialist known for establishing the American Tobacco Company, revolutionizing cigarette manufacturing and marketing, and for his significant philanthropy, which led to the founding of Duke University.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1922 seems to capture the moment when James Buchanan Duke, at the peak of his career, was a powerful figure in the tobacco industry, enjoying the fruits of his labor and  looking toward the future of his legacy, which would be solidified with the establishment of Duke University.
title: James Buchanan Duke
name: James Buchanan Duke

description: Samuel Finley Breese Morse is a celebrated American inventor, painter, and artist who revolutionized communication with his invention of the telegraph and Morse code. mainEvents.description: First public demonstration of the electric telegraph

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1895 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Morse, now in his later years, reflects upon the profound impact his inventions have had on the world, a legacy that continues to shape communication and technology.

description: Samuel Smith is a prominent Maryland politician and military leader who served in the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War, as a Congressman, a Senator, and a Mayor of Baltimore. description: Roger Sherman is a Founding Father and one of the most influential members of the Constitutional Convention who is known for being the only person to sign all four great state papers of the United States.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in mid-late 19th century seems to capture the moment when Roger Sherman, with his impressive career as a lawyer, statesman and a Founding Father, is revered by Americans for his key role in shaping the new nation's government.
title: Roger Sherman
name: Roger Sherman

description: William George Fargo is a prominent American businessman and politician best known for co-founding the American Express Company and Wells Fargo, he served as the 27th mayor of Buffalo from 1862 to 1866.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1855 seems to capture the moment when William George Fargo, already a successful businessman and express company founder, was on the cusp of the tremendous growth of American Express and the establishment of Wells Fargo as a major force in the expanding American West.
title: William George Fargo
name: William George Fargo

description: Henry Lee is a prominent figure in American history, known for his military leadership during the Revolutionary War, his service as Governor of Virginia, and as the father of Confederate general Robert E. Lee.

mainEvents.description: Led Lee's Legion in Revolutionary War

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1834 seems to capture the moment when Henry Lee, after a lifetime of public service and military exploits, was enjoying the quietude of his later years, reflecting on his legacy, and perhaps, anticipating his inevitable end.
title: Henry Lee
name: Henry Lee

description: James Cochran Dobbin is a prominent 19th-century American politician and lawyer, most known for his tenure as the 22nd US Secretary of the Navy, where he oversaw major naval developments and the successful Perry Expedition to Japan.

description: Joshua Reed Giddings is a prominent American abolitionist and politician who served as a US Representative from Ohio from 1838-1859. Censured by the House for violating the gag rule
Helped to found the Republican Party

He was a powerful voice for the end of slavery and a key figure in the rise of the Republican Party, making him a crucial figure in the turbulent years leading to the Civil War.
title: Joshua Reed Giddings
