description: Richard Evelyn Byrd is a pioneering American aviator, polar explorer, and organizer of polar logistics, best known for his flights over the North and South poles, and for discovering Mount Sidley, the largest dormant volcano in Antarctica.

mainEvents.description: First flight over the North Pole
First flight over the South Pole

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1928 seems to capture the moment when Richard Evelyn Byrd was on the cusp of his first Antarctic expedition, which would solidify his place as a pioneering explorer and aviator.
title: Richard Evelyn Byrd
name: Richard Evelyn Byrd

description: Henry Clay is a prominent American statesman who served as the seventh Speaker of the House, ninth Secretary of State, and represented Kentucky in the Senate. He was a key figure in the development of the American System, a nationalistic economic plan, and earned the nickname "The Great Compromiser" for his role in resolving sectional crises, including the Missouri Compromise and the Compromise of 1850.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1849 seems to capture the moment when Henry Clay, having recently returned to the Senate, stands at the cusp of the Compromise of 1850. The events of his past, including his successes in the War of 1812 and the Missouri Compromise, and his failures in the 1824, 1832, and 1844 presidential elections, all converge on the weighty responsibility of shaping the future of the nation.
title: Henry Clay
name: Henry Clay

description: William Franklin Draper is a prominent American businessman, industrialist, and soldier who served as a U.S. Representative from Massachusetts, known for his contributions to textile manufacturing and his military service during the Civil War.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1890 seems to capture the moment when Draper was at the pinnacle of his career, having just served as a U.S. Representative and on the verge of being appointed U.S. Ambassador to Italy, reflecting his stature as a prominent figure in both politics and industry.
title: William Franklin Draper
name: William Franklin Draper

description: Frank Billings Kellogg is a renowned American lawyer, politician, and statesman, known for his role in drafting the Kellogg–Briand Pact, a landmark treaty aimed at outlawing war, which earned him the Nobel Peace Prize in 1929.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1925 seems to capture the moment when Kellogg, having just served as Ambassador to Great Britain, was embarking on his tenure as U.S. Secretary of State, a role that would see him champion international peace and diplomacy, culminating in the Kellogg–Briand Pact.
title: Frank Billings Kellogg
name: Frank Billings Kellogg

description: William Hull is a significant figure in American history, having served in the Revolutionary War and as the first governor of Michigan Territory. He is also remembered for his controversial surrender of Detroit in the War of 1812, which led to a court-martial and eventual pardon.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1823 seems to capture the moment when William Hull, though facing public censure for his surrender of Detroit, is still revered for his Revolutionary War service and his efforts to establish the Michigan Territory.
title: William Hull
name: William Hull

description: George Clinton is a prominent American statesman who served as the first governor of New York and the fourth vice president of the United States, and a key figure in the early American republic.

mainEvents.description: Born in Little Britain, New York
Served as a Lieutenant in the French and Indian War
Elected Vice President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1806 seems to capture the moment when George Clinton, in his late 60s, is serving as Vice President under Thomas Jefferson, a position he would hold until his death in 1812, making him the first vice president to die in office.
title: George Clinton
name: George Clinton

description: John Middleton Clayton is a prominent Delaware lawyer and politician who served as a U.S. Senator, Secretary of State, and Chief Justice of the Delaware Superior Court, known for his role in the Clayton-Bulwer Treaty and his advocacy for American expansion.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1843 seems to capture the moment when John Middleton Clayton, already a seasoned politician and lawyer, is on the cusp of national prominence, poised to negotiate the Clayton-Bulwer Treaty and secure his place as a key figure in the expansion of American influence.
title: John Middleton Clayton
name: John Middleton Clayton

description: Henry Larcom Abbot is a highly decorated military engineer and career officer in the United States Army, most famous for his work during the Civil War and his contributions to the Panama Canal.

mainEvents.description: Graduated second in his class at West Point
Wounded at the First Battle of Bull Run
Appointed brevet brigadier general of volunteers

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1857 seems to capture the moment when Henry Larcom Abbot, a young, talented military engineer, was embarking on a long and distinguished career in the U.S. Army, filled with scientific exploration and eventual leadership in the Civil War.
title: Henry Larcom Abbot
name: Henry Larcom Abbot

description: Boies Penrose is a powerful and influential American politician from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, serving as a Republican senator and political boss, known for his "squeeze bills" and pro-business policies.

mainEvents.description: Becomes Chairman of the Republican State Committee
Supports Warren Harding's nomination for president

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1926 seems to capture the moment when Boies Penrose, having reached the pinnacle of his political career, stands at the crossroads of his legacy, both revered and reviled for his political prowess and unyielding commitment to business interests.
title: Boies Penrose
name: Boies Penrose

description: Rodman McCamley Price is a 19th-century American naval officer, businessman, and politician who served as the 17th Governor of New Jersey from 1854 to 1857.  He was a key figure in the California Gold Rush, serving on San Francisco's first City Council and amassing a fortune in real estate.

mainEvents.description: Served as Purser in the US Navy
Elected to the First San Francisco City Council

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849-50 seems to capture the moment when Price was rising to prominence as a key figure in the California Gold Rush. He had just served on San Francisco's first City Council and was already becoming a prominent real estate tycoon, setting the stage for his future political career.
title: Rodman McCamley Price
name: Rodman McCamley Price

description: Fisher Ames is a prominent American politician and lawyer, a leading Federalist who championed a strong central government and opposed the rise of Jeffersonian Republicans. He is remembered for his oratorical skill, especially in defending the Jay Treaty, and his unwavering stance against slavery.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives
Delivered a famous speech in favor of the Jay Treaty

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1807 seems to capture the moment when Fisher Ames, having served in Congress and witnessed the rise of Republicanism,  returned to Dedham, Massachusetts. This time was one of reflection and renewed dedication to his Federalist ideals. He was concerned about the growing influence of the Republican Party, led by his own brother, and sought to strengthen the Federalist cause in his hometown.
title: Fisher Ames
name: Fisher Ames

description: Elisha Kent Kane is a prominent American explorer and military medical officer best known for his Arctic expeditions in search of Sir John Franklin's lost expedition. He was a gifted orator and published two books about his adventures, earning him great popularity.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1860 seems to capture the moment when Kane, having returned from his daring Arctic explorations, was at the height of his fame and public recognition. It reflects the period of his successful lectures and publications, showcasing the daring explorer and charismatic speaker.
title: Elisha Kent Kane
name: Elisha Kent Kane

description: Edward Everett Hale is a prominent American author, historian, and Unitarian minister best known for his pro-Union short story "The Man Without a Country" and for founding the "Lend a Hand" movement that promotes civic engagement.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1905-09 seems to capture the moment when Hale was in the twilight of his long and distinguished career, having served as a minister, author, and advocate for social reform, his legacy cemented by his influential writings and impactful philanthropic work.
title: Edward Everett Hale
name: Edward Everett Hale

description: William Lloyd Garrison is a prominent American abolitionist, journalist, and social reformer best known for his anti-slavery newspaper 'The Liberator', which he founded in 1831 and published in Boston until slavery in the United States was abolished by the Thirteenth Amendment in 1865.

mainEvents.description: Burned a copy of the Constitution

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1855 seems to capture the moment when Garrison was at the height of his influence as an abolitionist, known for his uncompromising and radical views, which had both galvanized supporters and drawn condemnation from opponents.  'The Liberator' had gained a wide readership and Garrison was a leading figure in the American Anti-Slavery Society. However, he was also facing growing criticism for his rejection of the Constitution and his support for women's rights, which would lead to division within the abolitionist movement.
title: William Lloyd Garrison
name: William Lloyd Garrison

description: Willard Huntington Wright is a prolific writer who published under the pseudonym S.S. Van Dine. Known for his literary and art criticism, he achieved fame with his detective novels featuring Philo Vance.

mainEvents.description: Published his first Philo Vance novel

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1913-14 seems to capture the moment when Wright, then a rising art critic, was exploring his passion for modern art and beginning to make his mark on the literary world. He had just moved to New York City and published his first critical essays on art. This portrait, painted by his brother, reflects the intellectual and artistic ferment of a young man on the cusp of greatness.
title: Willard Huntington Wright (S. S. Van Dine)
name: Willard Huntington Wright

description: John James Audubon is a renowned French-American ornithologist, artist, and naturalist known for his meticulous bird illustrations and his monumental work, "The Birds of America."  His paintings captured the beauty and grandeur of American birds in their natural habitats.

mainEvents.description: Audubon elected to the Royal Society

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1841 seems to capture the moment when John James Audubon, at the height of his career, is celebrating the successful completion of his "Birds of America" publication, and poised to embark on further expeditions and scientific exploration.
title: John James Audubon
name: John James Audubon

description: Charles Brockden Brown is a pioneering American novelist who helped define the Gothic genre and helped launch the American literary tradition.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1806 seems to capture the moment when Brown, at the peak of his literary powers, is poised to continue his exploration of Gothic themes and social critiques.
title: Charles Brockden Brown
name: Charles Brockden Brown

description: Joseph Story is a prominent lawyer, jurist, and politician known for his service as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, his influential legal writings, particularly on the U.S. Constitution, and his advocacy for a strong national Union.

mainEvents.description: Appointed Associate Justice of the Supreme Court
Published 'Commentaries on the Constitution of the United States'
Became first Dane Professor of Law at Harvard

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1827 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Story, already a prominent jurist and scholar, was on the cusp of establishing himself as a preeminent authority on the Constitution, solidifying his legacy as a cornerstone of early American jurisprudence.
title: Joseph Story
name: Joseph Story

description: Talcott Williams is a prominent American journalist, author, and educator best known for his role as the first director of the Columbia School of Journalism and his involvement in the early Pulitzer Prize awards.

mainEvents.description: Became Director of Columbia School of Journalism
Led first Pulitzer Prize journalism jury

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1889 seems to capture the moment when Talcott Williams, having established himself as a respected journalist and author, is on the cusp of a new chapter in his life, one dedicated to education and the advancement of journalism as a profession.
title: Talcott Williams
name: Talcott Williams

description: Henry James is a prominent American-British author whose work transitioned between literary realism and modernism, known for his nuanced explorations of social and psychological complexities, especially in his novels like The Portrait of a Lady and The Ambassadors.

mainEvents.description: James published The Portrait of a Lady.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900 seems to capture the moment when Henry James, having established himself as a leading novelist with works like The Portrait of a Lady, was exploring more experimental and complex styles in his writing, beginning to foreshadow the literary innovations of the 20th century.
title: Henry James
name: Henry James

description: Joseph Warren is a Founding Father of the United States, a physician, and a revolutionary leader who served as President of the Massachusetts Provincial Congress and was killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill.

mainEvents.description: Led Patriot activities during the Liberty Affair
President of the Massachusetts Provincial Congress
Killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1765 seems to capture the moment when Joseph Warren, a rising star in the field of medicine, was already a prominent figure in Boston's political scene, a budding patriot, and a key figure in the growing resistance to British rule.
title: Joseph Warren
name: Joseph Warren

description: Francis Patrick Garvan is a prominent American lawyer, government official, and the long-time president of the Chemical Foundation, Inc. He played a vital role in the development of the American chemical industry, particularly by overseeing the distribution of seized German patents after World War I.

mainEvents.description: Appointed president of the Chemical Foundation

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1921 seems to capture the moment when Garvan's legacy as a key figure in the American chemical industry was solidified. Having spearheaded the Chemical Foundation during its formative years, he was well on his way to establishing it as a prominent force in scientific and medical research, a path he continued until his death.
title: Francis Patrick Garvan
name: Francis Patrick Garvan

description: William James Glackens is a prominent American realist painter, co-founder of the Ashcan School, and key figure in the realist movement. He is known for his vibrant street scenes, depictions of daily life, and for his later, brighter style influenced by Renoir. He was also a magazine illustrator and helped form the Barnes Foundation collection.

mainEvents.description: Glackens and The Eight first exhibited

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1935 seems to capture the moment when William Glackens, in his mid-sixties, was shifting away from his earlier Ashcan style towards a more Impressionistic and Renoir-influenced one, as seen in the brighter palette and more fluid brushwork. This period also saw him become a leading figure in the art world, advising collectors like Albert C. Barnes and enjoying recognition for his work.
title: William Glackens Self-Portrait
name: William James Glackens

description: John Singleton Copley is a renowned Anglo-American painter, known for his realistic portraiture of prominent figures in colonial America and England. He was also a pioneer in history painting and a leading figure in the development of American art.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1780-84 seems to capture the moment when John Singleton Copley had established himself as a leading portrait painter in England. He was at the peak of his career, having achieved both critical and commercial success, and was beginning to explore new genres, such as history painting.
title: John Singleton Copley Self-Portrait
name: John Singleton Copley

description: Prince Paul of Yugoslavia is a controversial figure who served as Prince Regent of Yugoslavia during the minority of King Peter II. His reign was marked by political maneuvering and a delicate balancing act between the Axis and Allied powers during World War II.  Despite his Anglophile tendencies, he was criticized for his involvement with the Axis and ultimately was forced into exile.

mainEvents.description: Prince Paul was born in St. Petersburg.
Prince Paul became Prince Regent of Yugoslavia.
Prince Paul was overthrown in a coup d'état.
Prince Paul was reburied in Oplenac, Serbia.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1938 seems to capture the moment when Prince Paul, a man of cultivated taste and refined manners, navigated the turbulent political landscape of pre-war Europe.  While his Anglophile leanings were strong, his position demanded a delicate balancing act between the rising powers of Germany and Italy and his traditional alliances with France and Great Britain.  This portrait reflects his complex world of international intrigue and the uncertainty that loomed over the future of Yugoslavia.
title: Prince Paul of Yugoslavia
name: Prince Paul of Yugoslavia

description: Neville Chamberlain is a British politician known for his appeasement policy toward Nazi Germany, particularly the Munich Agreement, which ceded the Sudetenland to Germany. He served as Prime Minister during the early stages of World War II and is often criticized for his pre-war decisions.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1938 seems to capture the moment when Neville Chamberlain, at the height of his political career, was attempting to negotiate a peaceful solution to the growing threat of Nazi Germany, just before the events that would lead to the outbreak of World War II.
title: Neville Chamberlain
name: Neville Chamberlain

description: Louis Dembitz Brandeis is a prominent American lawyer and jurist, who served as an associate justice on the Supreme Court of the United States from 1916 to 1939. He was a key figure in the Progressive Era and a champion for social justice and workers' rights.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1937 seems to capture the moment when Brandeis, at the height of his career, was still a vital force in American legal and social reform.  Having served on the Supreme Court for over 20 years, his legal and social activism was still making a significant impact on American law and society, particularly with the Supreme Court upholding the New Deal and the rise of legal concepts such as the "Brandeis Brief" and the "right to privacy".
title: Louis Brandeis
name: Louis Dembitz Brandeis

description: Nathaniel Hawthorne is a prominent American novelist and short story writer renowned for his dark romanticism and exploration of morality, sin, and history.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1862 seems to capture the moment when Hawthorne, a man on the cusp of his literary acclaim and facing personal losses, reflects on a lifetime of artistic and political experiences.
title: Nathaniel Hawthorne
name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

description: Charlotte Saunders Cushman is a celebrated American stage actress known for her contralto voice and her ability to portray both male and female roles. She was a pioneer in a time when women were still fighting for acceptance in the theater world.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1853 seems to capture the moment when Cushman was at the height of her career, having already established herself as a renowned actress in both America and Europe, before retiring from the stage to focus on her personal life.
title: Charlotte Cushman
name: Charlotte Saunders Cushman

description: Peggy Bacon is a prominent American artist known for her satirical caricatures, illustrations, and paintings. She was a prolific creator with over 60 illustrated books, including mysteries, and her works appeared in renowned magazines such as The New Yorker and Vanity Fair.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1932 seems to capture the moment when Peggy Bacon had established herself as a prominent artist, gaining recognition for her satirical caricatures in magazines and galleries. Her career was flourishing after gaining renown for her work in publications like 'The New Yorker' and 'Vanity Fair', and she was beginning to focus on illustrations and book writing. The portrait reflects the confidence of a talented artist at the peak of her powers, poised for even greater success.
title: Peggy Bacon
name: Peggy Bacon

description: John Vaughan is a prominent figure in Philadelphia's 18th and 19th centuries, known for his work as a wine merchant, philanthropist, and dedicated member of the American Philosophical Society. He played a crucial role in building the Society's library and fostering a strong intellectual community.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1823 seems to capture the moment when John Vaughan, having established himself as a respected citizen of Philadelphia, is deeply immersed in his work for the American Philosophical Society, a dedication that would define the latter half of his life.
title: John Vaughan
name: John Vaughan

description: Alexander von Humboldt is a Prussian polymath known for his explorations of the Americas and his pioneering work in biogeography,  geomagnetism, and environmentalism.  He was a prolific writer and a gifted storyteller, his work influenced Charles Darwin, John Muir, and many others.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1855 seems to capture the moment when Alexander von Humboldt was at the pinnacle of his career,  having just finished his groundbreaking five-volume Kosmos, a work that sought to unify all scientific knowledge and culture.
title: Alexander von Humboldt
name: Alexander von Humboldt

description: Lewis Morris is a prominent Founding Father, landowner, and developer, known for his role in the American Revolution, signing the Declaration of Independence, and advocating for land ownership rights for colonists.

mainEvents.description: Served in New York State Senate

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1750 seems to capture the moment when Lewis Morris, a man of wealth and influence, is on the cusp of his political career, just before his active role in the American Revolution.  He has already served in the New York General Assembly and is about to embark on a journey that will shape his life and the fate of the nation.
title: Lewis Morris
name: Lewis Morris

description: John Adams is a Founding Father and the second president of the United States, known for his role in the American Revolution, his strong advocacy for independence, and his later correspondence with his political rival Thomas Jefferson.

mainEvents.description: Defended British soldiers in the Boston Massacre
Helped draft the Declaration of Independence

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1815 seems to capture the moment when John Adams, a retired president, is reflecting on his long and tumultuous career, but is also enjoying a renewed friendship with his old rival, Thomas Jefferson.
title: John Adams
name: John Adams

description: Samuel Miles is a prominent figure in Pennsylvania history, known for his military service during the French and Indian War and the American Revolution, his political career as a member of the Pennsylvania Assembly and Mayor of Philadelphia, and his contributions as a businessman and founder of the town of Milesburg, Pennsylvania.

mainEvents.description: Appointed Colonel of Pennsylvania State Rifle Regiment

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1800 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Miles, now in his early sixties, is reflecting on his life of service, having served as a military officer, a politician, and a businessman, all while contributing to the growth of Pennsylvania.
title: Samuel Miles
name: Samuel Miles

description: Samuel Jones Tilden is a prominent American politician who served as the 25th governor of New York and the Democratic nominee in the disputed 1876 United States presidential election. He was a skilled lawyer and political strategist who fought against corruption and advocated for reforms.

mainEvents.description: Born in New Lebanon, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1870 seems to capture the moment when Samuel Jones Tilden was on the cusp of his political ascendancy, having just won election as governor of New York, paving the way for his nomination as the Democratic presidential candidate in the contentious 1876 election.
title: Samuel Jones Tilden
name: Samuel Jones Tilden

description: Richard Bache is a businessman, marine insurance underwriter, and Postmaster-General, known for his connection to Benjamin Franklin as his son-in-law.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1792-93 seems to capture the moment when Richard Bache, after serving as Postmaster General, was settling into a comfortable life with his wife, Sarah, and their children, benefiting from the inheritance from his father-in-law, Benjamin Franklin.
title: Richard Bache
name: Richard Bache

description: George Washington is a Founding Father, military leader, and statesman known for leading the Continental Army to victory in the Revolutionary War, presiding over the Constitutional Convention, and serving as the first President of the United States. He is revered as the "Father of His Country" for his contributions to the creation and development of the nation.

mainEvents.description: First President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in after 1796 seems to capture the moment when George Washington, having retired to Mount Vernon after a lifetime of service, reflects on his legacy as the nation he helped found navigates its early years as a republic.
title: George Washington
name: George Washington

description: George Clymer is a Founding Father who signed both the Declaration of Independence and the Constitution, a significant figure in the American Revolution.  He was a member of the Continental Congress, and served as Treasurer with Michael Hillegas.  Clymer opposed the slave trade and attempted to regulate it.

mainEvents.description: First President of the Philadelphia Bank

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1807-10 seems to capture the moment when George Clymer, having reached his late 60s, was enjoying the fruits of his labors, having served as a founding father and political leader, though his political career was nearing its end.
title: George Clymer
name: George Clymer

description: George Read is a prominent American Founding Father and politician who served as a delegate to the U.S. Constitutional Convention, a U.S. Senator from Delaware, and Chief Justice of Delaware. He also served as President of Delaware during the Revolutionary War, a Continental Congressman, and was a member of the Federalist Party.

mainEvents.description: George Read served in the Continental Congress
George Read signed the Declaration of Independence
George Read served as President of Delaware

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1784 seems to capture the moment when George Read, now a seasoned statesman, had just served as President of Delaware during the war and was on his way to greater heights as a senator and Chief Justice, a testament to his significant contributions to the nascent nation.
title: George Read
name: George Read

description: Frederick Augustus Conrad Muhlenberg is a prominent figure in early American history, serving as the first Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives and the first Dean of the House. He was also a Lutheran minister, a delegate to the Continental Congress, and a member of the Pennsylvania state constitutional convention.

mainEvents.description: Elected Speaker of the U.S. House
Cast deciding vote for nation's capital

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1790 seems to capture the moment when Muhlenberg, newly elected as the first Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, was at the pinnacle of his political career, balancing the demands of his religious calling with the weighty responsibility of shaping the new nation's legislative future.
title: Frederick Augustus Conrad Muhlenberg
name: Frederick Augustus Conrad Muhlenberg

description: Franklin Delano Roosevelt is a towering figure in American history, known for his leadership during the Great Depression and World War II, his enduring legacy as the 'father of the New Deal', and his unique ability to connect with the American public through his 'fireside chats'.

mainEvents.description: Born in Hyde Park, New York
Led the US into World War II

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1933 seems to capture the moment when Franklin Delano Roosevelt, the new president, was brimming with hope and determination, ready to tackle the Great Depression with his bold New Deal programs, a symbol of renewed optimism and a champion for the common man.
title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt
name: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

description: Myron Timothy Herrick is a prominent American banker, diplomat, and Republican politician who served as the 42nd governor of Ohio and the United States Ambassador to France twice, known for his contributions to French-American amity during World War I.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1925 seems to capture the moment when Myron Timothy Herrick was at the height of his diplomatic career, having served as the U.S. Ambassador to France for a second time, and just a few years before his death. This portrait embodies the essence of a seasoned diplomat who had witnessed the turmoil of World War I and its aftermath, and now navigated the complexities of international relations with grace and wisdom.
title: Myron T. Herrick
name: Myron Timothy Herrick

description: James Robert Mann is a prominent American politician and lawyer who served as a member of the United States House of Representatives from Illinois, known for his role as House Minority Leader and author of the Mann Act.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1910-25 seems to capture the moment when James Robert Mann, having established himself as a significant figure in the House of Representatives, was on the cusp of his most impactful legislative achievement - the passage of the Mann Act, which would forever be linked to his name.
title: James Robert Mann
name: James Robert Mann

description: Robert Morris is a prominent American merchant, politician, and Founding Father who played a pivotal role in financing the American Revolution. He served as Superintendent of Finance, a U.S. Senator from Pennsylvania, and a signer of key historical documents including the Declaration of Independence, Articles of Confederation, and the U.S. Constitution.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1785 seems to capture the moment when Robert Morris, at the height of his influence and having just secured the crucial victory at Yorktown, is on the verge of implementing his ambitious plans for a unified and financially stable nation.
title: Robert Morris
name: Robert Morris

description: Henry Clay is a prominent American statesman known for his role in shaping American policy, notably the Missouri Compromise and the Compromise of 1850. He was a skilled orator and advocate for the 'American System' of economic development. He was also a slaveholder, a fact that complicates his legacy.

mainEvents.description: Clay becomes U.S. Secretary of State

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when Henry Clay, having clashed with President Tyler over the re-establishment of the national bank, finds himself in a political limbo, uncertain of his future in the Whig Party and preparing for a presidential campaign that will prove unsuccessful.
title: Henry Clay
name: Henry Clay

description: Louis McLane is a prominent American lawyer and politician who served in various roles, including U.S. Representative, U.S. Senator, Secretary of the Treasury, Secretary of State, and ambassador to Great Britain. A key figure in the Bank War, he was a member of President Andrew Jackson's Cabinet and  helped draft the Force Bill of 1833.  He is also known for his successful service as President of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.

mainEvents.description: McLane served in the U.S. House of Representatives
McLane served as Secretary of the Treasury
McLane served as Secretary of State

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1820 seems to capture the moment when Louis McLane was on the cusp of his greatest achievements, having served in the U.S. House and Senate, but prior to assuming the high-profile roles of Secretary of the Treasury and Secretary of State, and before leading the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad into a period of rapid expansion.
title: Louis McLane
name: Louis McLane

description: Daniel of St. Thomas Jenifer is a prominent Founding Father and politician who served as a key figure in the Maryland government before and during the American Revolution and as one of the signers of the Constitution of the United States.

mainEvents.description: President of Maryland's Council of Safety

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1760-70 seems to capture the moment when Daniel of St. Thomas Jenifer, a young, successful, and influential planter, was beginning to see the increasing tensions between the colonies and Great Britain, leading him to become an ardent defender of colonial rights.
title: Daniel of St. Thomas Jenifer
name: Daniel of St. Thomas Jenifer

description: William Starke Rosecrans is a prominent Union general during the American Civil War, known for his victories in the Western Theater, but also for his controversial defeat at Chickamauga. After the war, he served in diplomatic and political roles.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1868 seems to capture the moment when Rosecrans, having recently served as the U.S. Minister to Mexico, is considering his future path, having left the Army behind, but still considering his political future.
title: William Starke Rosecrans
name: William Starke Rosecrans

description: Henry Clay is a prominent American statesman known for his role in shaping national policy during the first half of the 19th century. He served in both the House and Senate, was Speaker of the House several times, and was Secretary of State. He was a key figure in developing the American System, the Missouri Compromise, the Compromise of 1850, and the Whig Party.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1848 seems to capture the moment when Henry Clay, having weathered numerous political storms and a devastating personal loss during the Mexican-American War, stands on the cusp of one final great triumph, the Compromise of 1850.
title: Henry Clay
name: Henry Clay

description: Stephen Grover Cleveland is a 22nd and 24th President of the United States, remembered for his political reform efforts, his fight against corruption, and his firm stance on the gold standard.  He was one of the only Democrats to win the presidency in the late 19th century and was known for his strong sense of morality.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1884 seems to capture the moment when Cleveland was on the cusp of national prominence,  a young and determined reformer  who would soon become the Governor of New York and then, just two years later, President of the United States.
title: Grover Cleveland
name: Stephen Grover Cleveland

description: John Armstrong is a prominent American soldier, diplomat, and statesman, known for his roles in the Revolutionary War, the Newburgh Conspiracy, the War of 1812, and as a U.S. Senator from New York and U.S. Secretary of War.

mainEvents.description: Served as U.S. Secretary of War
Died in Red Hook, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1812 seems to capture the moment when John Armstrong, a seasoned Revolutionary War veteran, had just entered his second term as a U.S. Senator and was nearing the end of his service as U.S. Minister to France. He would later become a Brigadier General in the War of 1812 and Secretary of War, showcasing his enduring commitment to public service.

description: Gulian Crommelin Verplanck is a prominent American attorney, politician, and writer of the 19th century, who served in the New York State Assembly, the United States House of Representatives, and the New York State Senate. description: William Samuel Johnson is a prominent American Founding Father, statesman, and jurist who played a pivotal role in shaping the nation's early government. Johnson also served as the third president of Columbia University.

name: William Samuel Johnson

description: Woodrow Wilson is a 28th US president known for his progressive domestic policies, leadership during World War I, and the creation of the League of Nations, which he later failed to bring the US into. However, he was criticized for racist policies such as segregating the federal bureaucracy.

name: Woodrow Wilson

description: William Clark is a prominent figure in American history, renowned for his leadership in the Lewis and Clark Expedition, exploring the Louisiana Purchase and charting the path to the Pacific Ocean. description: John Marshall is a prominent Founding Father, serving as the longest-serving Chief Justice of the United States, shaping American law and judicial review.

Appointed Chief Justice of the US
Decided the Marbury v. Madison case

Madison decision, and before his more controversial later decisions.

The portrait reflects the hardships and resilience of the Nez Perce in their struggle for survival.

description: Isaac Merrit Singer is a renowned American inventor and businessman who revolutionized the sewing industry with his practical and affordable sewing machines. It was a time of immense personal and professional triumph, marked by his move to England and the construction of his grand estate, Oldway Mansion.

name: Isaac Merrit Singer

description: Bret Harte is a renowned American short story writer and poet best known for his tales set during the California Gold Rush. His iconic characters, like those in "The Luck of Roaring Camp" and "The Outcasts of Poker Flat", captured the rough-and-tumble spirit of the era.

title: Bret Harte
name: Bret Harte

Engaged at Chestnut Street Theatre, Philadelphia

description: Thomas Nast is a renowned German-born American caricaturist and editorial cartoonist, often hailed as the "Father of the American Cartoon." He is known for his satirical illustrations that exposed corruption and influenced political discourse, including his iconic depictions of Santa Claus and the Republican elephant.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1887 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Nast, nearing the end of his illustrious career at Harper's Weekly, was still a powerful force in American politics, but was also facing increasing financial struggles and creative challenges. He had already exposed corruption and helped shape the political landscape, but his influence was waning as newer styles of cartooning emerged.

description: Thomas Loraine McKenney is a prominent American government official known for his tenure as Superintendent of Indian Affairs and his advocacy for the American Indian "civilization" program, which led to the removal of Native American tribes west of the Mississippi River.

title: Thomas McKenney
name: Thomas Loraine McKenney

description: George Benjamin Luks is a prominent American artist, a key figure in the Ashcan School, known for his realistic depictions of urban life and working-class individuals, particularly in New York City.

Ochs also introduced the iconic motto 'All the News That's Fit to Print'.

description: Edith Wharton is a renowned American novelist, short story writer, and designer, known for her insightful portrayals of upper-class New York society during the Gilded Age. Wharton was also a prominent socialite, travel enthusiast, and a champion of French causes during World War I.

description: Henry Clay is a prominent American statesman, known as "The Great Compromiser" for his key roles in resolving sectional crises like the Missouri Compromise and the Compromise of 1850. His popularity during the war led him to be elected as the 12th President of the United States. He was the first president to be elected without having previously held political office. description: Winfield Scott is a renowned American military commander and political candidate.
