Known for his exceptional business acumen, he founded the Peabody Trust to provide affordable housing for London's poor, and established numerous educational institutions in the US, including the Peabody Institute in Baltimore.

mainEvents.description: Founded Peabody Trust for housing in London

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1854 seems to capture the moment when George Peabody, now firmly established as a leading banker in London, was at the peak of his financial power and beginning to shift his focus towards philanthropy, having recently partnered with Junius Spencer Morgan and founded the Peabody Trust. The portrait reflects a sense of gravitas, achievement, and perhaps even a hint of the philanthropic vision that would define his later years.
title: George Peabody
name: George Peabody

description: Frances Folsom Cleveland is a prominent figure in American history, best known as the wife of President Grover Cleveland, serving as First Lady during his two non-consecutive terms. She is the youngest and the only First Lady to have married in the White House.

mainEvents.description: Frances Folsom Cleveland married President Grover Cleveland.
Frances Folsom Cleveland served as First Lady.
Frances Folsom Cleveland served as First Lady for a second term.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1899 seems to capture the moment when Frances Cleveland is at the peak of her popularity and influence. She is now a mother and a wife, having served two terms as First Lady and navigating the challenges of raising a family while maintaining her own identity.
title: Frances Folsom Cleveland
name: Frances Folsom Cleveland

description: Thomas Paine is a revolutionary writer, political philosopher, and activist who championed liberty, reason, and democracy, contributing significantly to the American Revolution and advocating for social reforms like universal suffrage and a basic income.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the French National Convention

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1792 seems to capture the moment when Thomas Paine, a staunch advocate for revolutionary ideals, was navigating the turbulent waters of the French Revolution, facing imprisonment and persecution, yet steadfast in his belief in reason and human rights.
title: Thomas Paine
name: Thomas Paine

description: Dolley Dandridge Payne Todd Madison is a prominent figure in American history, best known as the wife of President James Madison and for her role as the First Lady of the United States during his presidency. She is remembered for her elegant social gatherings that helped bridge political divides, her heroic actions during the burning of Washington, and her enduring legacy as a symbol of grace and strength.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1848 seems to capture the moment when Dolley Madison, widowed and in her late 70s, is reflecting on a lifetime of accomplishments and tribulations, from her early life in Quaker communities and her roles as a wife, mother, and hostess to her service as First Lady, her resilience during the War of 1812, and her enduring contributions to the nation's history.
title: Dolley Madison
name: Dolley Dandridge Payne Todd Madison

description: William McKinley is a significant figure in American history as the 25th President of the United States, who led the nation to victory in the Spanish-American War, and oversaw a period of economic prosperity.

mainEvents.description: Elected President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1901 seems to capture the moment when William McKinley, as the victor of the Spanish-American War, stands at the zenith of his political power and the nation he leads enjoys great economic success.
title: William McKinley
name: William McKinley

description: William Learned Marcy is a prominent 19th-century American politician who served as Governor of New York, Secretary of War, and Secretary of State, known for his role in the Albany Regency and the Gadsden Purchase.

mainEvents.description: Died in Ballston Spa, New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1850s seems to capture the moment when William Learned Marcy, a seasoned politician, stood at the pinnacle of his career, having served as Governor of New York, Secretary of War, and was now the Secretary of State, a testament to his political prowess and influence.
title: William Learned Marcy
name: William Learned Marcy

description: Stephen Grover Cleveland is a significant figure in American history, serving as the 22nd and 24th President of the United States and the only person to serve two non-consecutive terms. A strong advocate for fiscal conservatism, he is remembered for his commitment to honesty and good governance. His administration saw important legislation like the Interstate Commerce Act and the Dawes Act, as well as the controversial suppression of the Pullman Strike.

mainEvents.description: First Elected President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1897 seems to capture the moment when Cleveland, having faced the economic turmoil of the Panic of 1893, had begun to lose popular support but remained dedicated to his principles of fiscal responsibility and limited government.
title: Grover Cleveland
name: Stephen Grover Cleveland

description: Martin Van Buren is a key figure in American political history, serving as the 8th U.S. president and a founder of the Democratic Party. Known as the 'Little Magician' for his political maneuvering, he held various positions in New York state government before becoming Jackson's Vice President and succeeding him in the presidency.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1837 seems to capture the moment when Martin Van Buren, having ascended from New York state politics to the presidency, was on the precipice of facing the Panic of 1837, a defining moment in his career. It was a time of both triumph and uncertainty, as he was about to navigate the complexities of national leadership in an era of economic turmoil.
title: Martin Van Buren
name: Martin Van Buren

description: Tenskwatawa is a Shawnee religious and political leader, known as "The Prophet", who led a purification movement against white acculturation and promoted unity among Indigenous peoples of North America. He was the younger brother of Tecumseh, a famous Shawnee warrior and leader.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1830-33 seems to capture the moment when Tenskwatawa was in the final years of his life, having lost the influence he once held, and living as an exile in Kansas, after the defeat of his brother Tecumseh and the demise of their pan-Indian resistance movement. This portrait embodies Tenskwatawa, the fading prophet, and represents his once powerful spirit, now in a state of reflection.
title: Tenskwatawa
name: Tenskwatawa

description: Franklin Delano Roosevelt is a pivotal figure in American history, serving as president during both the Great Depression and World War II. He implemented the New Deal to combat the Depression, oversaw the mobilization of the U.S. into World War II, and established the United Nations.

mainEvents.description: Born in Hyde Park, New York
Elected President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1935 seems to capture the moment when Franklin Delano Roosevelt, having successfully navigated the initial phases of the New Deal, faces the escalating challenges of the Great Depression and a world on the precipice of war.
title: Franklin D. Roosevelt
name: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

description: John Cabell Breckinridge is a prominent Kentucky lawyer, politician, and soldier who served as the 14th vice president of the United States and as the Confederate Secretary of War.

mainEvents.description: Elected as a Democratic Vice President
Expelled from US Senate for siding with Confederacy

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in after 1860 seems to capture the moment when John Cabell Breckinridge, a man once considered a rising star within the Democratic party, faced the consequences of his controversial political decisions and wartime allegiances, a time marked by deep political division and the aftermath of a devastating war.
title: John Cabell Breckinridge
name: John Cabell Breckinridge

description: George Washington is a Founding Father of the United States, renowned military leader, and the first president of the nation, known as the "Father of His Country" for his contributions to its independence and establishment.

mainEvents.description: First President of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1785 seems to capture the moment when George Washington, having successfully led the Continental Army to victory in the American Revolution and secured American independence, was transitioning into a civilian life and navigating the challenges of shaping the new nation's destiny.
title: George Washington
name: George Washington

description: Charles Cotesworth Pinckney is a prominent American statesman, Founding Father, and military officer who served as a delegate to the Constitutional Convention, the U.S. Minister to France, and a Federalist presidential nominee.

mainEvents.description: Born in Charles Town, South Carolina

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1796 seems to capture the moment when Charles Cotesworth Pinckney, having served as a Brigadier General in the Revolutionary War and a delegate to the Constitutional Convention, was about to embark on his diplomatic mission to France, a mission that would soon lead to the infamous XYZ Affair.
title: Charles Cotesworth Pinckney
name: Charles Cotesworth Pinckney

description: Robert Edward Lee is a renowned Confederate general during the American Civil War, known for his tactical brilliance and leadership of the Army of Northern Virginia. He is a complex figure whose legacy is marked by both military achievements and his views on slavery and race.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1876 seems to capture the moment when Lee, after the tumultuous years of the Civil War, had settled into a quiet life as president of Washington College, a role he embraced with the same dedication he brought to his military career.
title: Robert Edward Lee
name: Robert Edward Lee

description: Jefferson Davis is a prominent figure in American history, serving as the president of the Confederate States during the Civil War. A West Point graduate and military veteran, he was a staunch advocate for states' rights and Southern interests, leading the Confederacy through its tumultuous period of conflict and ultimately facing imprisonment for treason.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849 seems to capture the moment when Jefferson Davis, a rising star in the Democratic Party, was at the pinnacle of his political career. Having served as a U.S. Senator, Secretary of War, and recently married Varina Howell, he stood poised as a defender of Southern interests, a position that would ultimately lead him to the presidency of the Confederate States.
title: Jefferson Davis
name: Jefferson Davis

description: Rufus King is a prominent figure in early American history, serving as a Founding Father, delegate to the Constitutional Convention, and a key member of the Federalist Party. His political career spanned decades, including terms as U.S. Senator, minister to Great Britain, and unsuccessful presidential candidate. He was a staunch opponent of slavery and a significant figure in New York politics.

mainEvents.description: Served as Minister to Great Britain

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1819-20 seems to capture the moment when Rufus King, at the age of 64, stood on the precipice of his political career. He had been a prominent figure in the Federalist Party but had witnessed its decline. Despite this, he had recently served another term in the U.S. Senate, demonstrating his continued influence and dedication to his principles.  The portrait reflects his age and experience, yet also his enduring commitment to the ideals of the early republic.
title: Rufus King
name: Rufus King

description: Henry Laurens is a prominent American Founding Father, slave trader, and merchant, known for his role in the American Revolution and his presidency of the Continental Congress. He was a signatory to the Articles of Confederation and a skilled diplomat who negotiated Dutch support for the war. Laurens was captured by the British and imprisoned in the Tower of London for over a year.

mainEvents.description: Captured by British, imprisoned in the Tower of London

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1782 seems to capture the moment when Henry Laurens, recently released from the Tower of London, is reflecting upon his time as a prisoner of war and his unwavering commitment to the American cause. His experience in the Tower, though a stark reminder of the human cost of freedom, deepened his determination to secure American independence, and this resolute spirit shines through in his gaze.
title: Henry Laurens
name: Henry Laurens

description: Zachary Taylor is a military hero who rose to the presidency after his victories in the Mexican-American War. Although a slaveholder, he opposed the expansion of slavery and sought to preserve the Union. Taylor's presidency was tragically cut short by a sudden illness.

mainEvents.description: Taylor fought in the Battle of Fort Harrison.
Taylor led troops in the Black Hawk War.
Taylor was elected President of the United States.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1849 seems to capture the moment when Zachary Taylor, a war hero with a strong sense of duty, stands poised on the precipice of his presidency, a time of great national tension and uncertainty.
title: Zachary Taylor
name: Zachary Taylor

description: Minnie Maddern Fiske is a prominent American actress of the late 19th and early 20th century known for her roles in Ibsen plays and her fight for artistic freedom against the Theatrical Syndicate.

mainEvents.description: Debut as Nora in A Doll's House
Starred as Becky Sharp in Becky Sharp

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1893 seems to capture the moment when Minnie Maddern Fiske, a young, rising star, is about to make her mark on the American stage as a playwright and director, after returning to the theatre following a three-year hiatus for domesticity.
title: Minnie Maddern Fiske
name: Minnie Maddern Fiske

description: John Wesley Powell is a renowned American geologist, explorer, and anthropologist, most famous for his daring expedition through the Grand Canyon, where he became the first to officially traverse the Colorado River. He significantly contributed to the study of the American West and advocated for its preservation. Powell's legacy includes impactful scientific research, the creation of major institutions, and the founding of the Cosmos Club.

mainEvents.description: Born in Mount Morris, New York
Led the first expedition through the Grand Canyon
Appointed Director of the U.S. Geological Survey

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1889 seems to capture the moment when John Wesley Powell, having established himself as a leading figure in American exploration and science, was at the peak of his influence. His leadership of the U.S. Geological Survey, coupled with his advocacy for the preservation of the American West, placed him at the forefront of national policy debates.
title: John Wesley Powell
name: John Wesley Powell

description: Pocahontas is a Native American woman of the Powhatan tribe, known for her role in early English colonization of Virginia.  She is famous for saving the life of John Smith, her conversion to Christianity, and her marriage to John Rolfe. She became a cultural icon, influencing numerous artistic and literary representations.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in after 1616 seems to capture the moment when Pocahontas, having converted to Christianity, is about to embrace the world of English society, a pivotal moment in her life.
title: Pocahontas
name: Pocahontas

description: Henry James is a major literary figure known for his psychological realism, complex characters, and nuanced depictions of social dynamics, particularly between Americans and Europeans. His unique writing style, often compared to Impressionist painting, has influenced many 20th-century novelists.

mainEvents.description: Published The Portrait of a Lady

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1908 seems to capture the moment when Henry James, having achieved literary acclaim, was experiencing a creative peak, marked by the publication of complex and influential novels like 'The Ambassadors' and 'The Golden Bowl'.
title: Henry James
name: Henry James

description: William Wirt is a prominent American attorney general, writer, and orator, best known for his role in the Aaron Burr trial, his tenure as Attorney General for 12 years, and as the first third-party presidential nominee to carry a state.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1809-10 seems to capture the moment when William Wirt, fresh from his success in the Burr trial, stands on the cusp of a brilliant legal and political career, his future full of promise and potential.
title: William Wirt
name: William Wirt

description: John Howard Payne is a prolific American actor, playwright, and author best known for writing "Home! Sweet Home!" in 1822, a song which became very popular in the United States and the English-speaking world.

mainEvents.description: Made his debut in New York

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1812 seems to capture the moment when John Howard Payne was still a young, talented, and ambitious actor, finding success in London but yet to reach his peak as a playwright and become the man who wrote the beloved song "Home, Sweet Home".
title: John Howard Payne
name: John Howard Payne

description: James Monroe is a Founding Father and the fifth president of the United States, known for his role in the Louisiana Purchase and the Monroe Doctrine, a policy that limited European colonialism in the Americas. He was also a veteran of the American Revolutionary War.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1834 seems to capture the moment when James Monroe, in the twilight of his life, reflects on a career filled with accomplishments, including securing the Louisiana Purchase and establishing the Monroe Doctrine, which shaped the destiny of the United States.
title: James Monroe
name: James Monroe

description: Andrew Jackson is a controversial American figure, a military leader, and the seventh president of the United States. He is known for his victory in the Battle of New Orleans, his role in the Indian Removal Act, and his conflict with the Second Bank of the United States. Jackson is remembered as a powerful advocate for the common man and his role in the expansion of American democracy, but his actions have also been condemned as a brutal violation of Native American rights.

mainEvents.description: Fought in the Battle of New Orleans

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1817? seems to capture the moment when Andrew Jackson was in the middle of a string of military victories. He had just defeated the British in the Battle of New Orleans and had secured Florida for the United States. He would go on to become a national hero and would be elected President in 1828. This portrait shows a man full of confidence and determination, ready to face any challenge.
title: Andrew Jackson
name: Andrew Jackson

description: John Quincy Adams is a prominent historical figure who served as the sixth President of the United States, the eighth Secretary of State, and later, a member of the U.S. House of Representatives. He is known for negotiating the Adams-Onís Treaty, formulating the Monroe Doctrine, and his staunch opposition to slavery.

mainEvents.description: Appointed as the U.S. Minister to Russia
Served as the U.S. Secretary of State

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1815 seems to capture the moment when John Quincy Adams, having just concluded his term as U.S. Minister to Russia and negotiated the Treaty of Ghent, is about to embark on his next diplomatic post, the U.S. Minister to the United Kingdom.
title: John Quincy Adams
name: John Quincy Adams

description: John Randolph is a prominent Virginian planter and politician known for his fiery oratory, conservative stance, and eccentric personality.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1829-30 seems to capture the moment when John Randolph, a staunch defender of the Southern way of life, is at the peak of his political influence, but also nearing the end of his career, his health failing and his legacy still being debated.
title: John Randolf of Roanoke
name: John Randolph

description: Franklin Pierce is a controversial 14th President of the United States who served from 1853 to 1857. Pierce is known for his support of the controversial Kansas-Nebraska Act, which led to violent conflict over the expansion of slavery in the American West. He is often ranked among the worst presidents in American history due to his failure to resolve the sectional crisis that led to the Civil War.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in November 1852 seems to capture the moment when Franklin Pierce, a rising star in the Democratic Party, is on the cusp of a controversial presidency. Just weeks away from his election victory, Pierce is likely feeling a mix of anticipation and apprehension, as he prepares to navigate a nation deeply divided over slavery.
title: Franklin Pierce
name: Franklin Pierce

description: George Washington is a Founding Father, military leader, and the first president of the United States, revered as "the Father of His Country" for his contributions to the nation's founding.

mainEvents.description: Led the Continental Army to victory in the Revolutionary War

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1800 seems to capture the moment when George Washington, having served two terms as president, was deeply involved in the Quasi-War with France, and was preparing to resume command of the U.S. Army.
title: George Washington
name: George Washington

description: Henry Clay is a prominent figure in American history known for his role in shaping national policy, especially concerning economic development, slavery, and sectional crises.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives
Led the U.S. into the War of 1812

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 or 1848 seems to capture the moment when Henry Clay, a seasoned statesman and advocate for compromise, grappled with the rising tensions of the burgeoning sectional crisis over slavery, particularly in the wake of the Mexican-American War.
title: Henry Clay
name: Henry Clay

description: Thomas Jonathan Jackson is a Confederate general most known for his command of the Stonewall Brigade during the American Civil War, earning him the nickname "Stonewall". He was known for his religious zeal and aggressive tactics.

mainEvents.description: Jackson was born in Clarksburg, Virginia.
Jackson was wounded at the Battle of Chancellorsville.
Jackson died of pneumonia after being shot by Confederate troops.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1876 seems to capture the moment when Jackson's legacy as a military leader was solidified, even though it was taken after his death and the end of the Civil War. He was a pivotal figure in the Confederacy and his life, as well as his death, became the inspiration for a significant amount of "Lost Cause" mythology.
title: Thomas Jonathan Jackson
name: Thomas Jonathan Jackson

description: Levi Parsons Morton is a prominent American politician and businessman who served as the 22nd vice president of the United States from 1889 to 1893, a successful investment banker, a U.S. representative from New York, and as the 31st governor of New York.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1883 seems to capture the moment when Levi Parsons Morton was on the rise of his political career, having served as the U.S. Minister to France and being considered for the Republican nomination for U.S. Senate, but before his elevation to the Vice Presidency in 1889.
title: Levi Parsons Morton
name: Levi Parsons Morton

description: Zachary Taylor is a decorated military officer who rose to national fame during the Mexican-American War, serving as the 12th President of the United States. He is known for his strong belief in preserving the Union and his aversion to politics. Taylor is also remembered for his untimely death while in office.

mainEvents.description: Taylor graduated from the U.S. Military Academy.
Taylor was commissioned as a Lieutenant Colonel in the U.S. Army.
Taylor served as a Brigadier General during the Second Seminole War.
Zachary Taylor died while in office.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1860 seems to capture the moment when Zachary Taylor, despite his brief but impactful presidency, stands as a symbol of a nation grappling with the growing sectional crisis over slavery. The portrait reflects a man who embraced the legacy of American heroism while facing the challenges of an increasingly divided country.
title: Zachary Taylor
name: Zachary Taylor

description: William McKinley is a 25th president of the United States known for his leadership during the Spanish-American War, expansionist policies, and his tragic assassination.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1900 seems to capture the moment when William McKinley, having led the nation to victory in the Spanish-American War, sits as the most powerful man in the world, the leader of a rising global superpower.
title: William McKinley
name: William McKinley

description: John Caldwell Calhoun is a prominent American statesman and political theorist known for his advocacy of states' rights and his staunch defense of slavery, which ultimately contributed to the South's secession and the Civil War.

mainEvents.description: Elected to the House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1823 seems to capture the moment when Calhoun, a rising star in the Democratic-Republican Party, had just begun his service as Secretary of War. His tenure as Secretary was marked by both nationalist reforms and the brewing tensions over slavery that would later define his political career.
title: John C. Calhoun
name: John Caldwell Calhoun

description: John Caldwell Calhoun is a prominent American statesman and political theorist, known for his fervent advocacy of states' rights and his complex and controversial defense of slavery.

mainEvents.description: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1822 seems to capture the moment when John C. Calhoun, at the peak of his early career, was a rising star in the Democratic-Republican Party, a staunch nationalist, and a leading figure in the War Hawks, a faction advocating war with Great Britain.
title: John Caldwell Calhoun
name: John Caldwell Calhoun

description: John Philip Sousa is a renowned American composer and conductor of the late Romantic era, widely recognized as "The March King" for his iconic military marches. He served as director of the United States Marine Band and led his own band on extensive tours, captivating audiences worldwide with his stirring music.

mainEvents.description: Led the Navy Band during WWI

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1909 seems to capture the moment when John Philip Sousa, already a renowned figure in the music world, stood at the peak of his career, his iconic marches deeply embedded in American culture.  He had just completed a decade of leading his own band on extensive tours, garnering international acclaim and solidifying his legacy as "The March King."
title: John Philip Sousa
name: John Philip Sousa

description: Abraham Lincoln is a self-taught lawyer who became the 16th President of the United States. He is known for preserving the Union during the Civil War, issuing the Emancipation Proclamation, and delivering the Gettysburg Address. Lincoln was assassinated in 1865.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1887 seems to capture the moment when Lincoln, having endured the weight of the nation's turmoil, reflects on the sacrifices made and the promise of a future built on freedom and unity.
title: Abraham Lincoln
name: Abraham Lincoln

description: David Crockett is a legendary American frontiersman, politician, and folk hero, known for his skills in hunting, storytelling, and fighting for the rights of common people. He served in the Tennessee legislature and the US Congress, and later fought in the Texas Revolution, ultimately dying at the Battle of the Alamo.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1834 seems to capture the moment when David Crockett, a congressman from Tennessee, was at the peak of his popularity, having authored his autobiography and become a national figure, but before his controversial journey to Texas and his fateful death at the Alamo.
title: Davy Crockett
name: David Crockett

description: Salmon Portland Chase is a prominent American politician and jurist who served as the 6th Chief Justice of the United States, Secretary of the Treasury, and Governor of Ohio.

mainEvents.description: Served as Secretary of the Treasury
Became Chief Justice of the United States
Presided over President Andrew Johnson's impeachment trial

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1861 seems to capture the moment when Salmon Portland Chase, a rising star in the Republican Party, was appointed by President Lincoln to serve as Secretary of the Treasury, a pivotal role in financing the Union's war effort.
title: Salmon P. Chase
name: Salmon Portland Chase

description: Henry Clay is a prominent American statesman, lawyer, and politician who served as a U.S. representative and senator for Kentucky, as the seventh Speaker of the House, and as the ninth Secretary of State. He was a leading figure in the development of the Whig Party, and his efforts to resolve sectional crises earned him the nickname 'the Great Compromiser.'

mainEvents.description: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives
Led the passage of the Missouri Compromise

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when Henry Clay, at the age of 65, is still a powerful figure in the Senate, having successfully resolved the Nullification Crisis and is beginning to prepare for his fourth run for the presidency.
title: Henry Clay
name: Henry Clay

description: Mary Stevenson Cassatt is a prominent American Impressionist painter known for her depictions of women and children, particularly mothers and their offspring, and her involvement with the Impressionist movement.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1880-84 seems to capture the moment when Mary Cassatt was becoming a recognized artist, collaborating with Edgar Degas, exploring the medium of pastel, and starting to define her signature style, particularly in her depictions of mothers and children.
title: Mary Cassatt
name: Mary Stevenson Cassatt

description: Daniel Webster is a prominent American lawyer and statesman who served as U.S. Secretary of State, a key member of the Whig Party, and a leading figure in the Great Triumvirate. He was a master orator and constitutional lawyer, known for his impassioned defense of the Union during the Nullification Crisis and his role in the Compromise of 1850.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1835 seems to capture the moment when Daniel Webster, at the peak of his legal and political career, stood as a staunch defender of the Union, a champion of national unity, and a formidable voice in the face of growing sectional tensions. His eloquent oratory and astute legal mind had already shaped the course of American history, and he would continue to play a pivotal role in the years to come.
title: Daniel Webster
name: Daniel Webster

description: James Monroe is a Founding Father and the fifth president of the United States, known for the Monroe Doctrine, which limited European colonialism in the Americas.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1816 seems to capture the moment when James Monroe, a seasoned diplomat and politician, was on the cusp of his presidency, having recently served as Secretary of State and War during the tumultuous War of 1812. He was poised to lead the nation through the 'Era of Good Feelings,' a time of relative peace and national unity.
title: James Monroe
name: James Monroe

description: Leonard Wood is a prominent military figure who served as the Chief of Staff of the U.S. Army, Governor-General of the Philippines, and Military Governor of Cuba.  He commanded the Rough Riders during the Spanish-American War, and was a leading Republican presidential candidate.

mainEvents.description: Served as Military Governor of Cuba.

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1903 seems to capture the moment when Leonard Wood, having led the Rough Riders to victory, had just been appointed Governor of Moro Province in the Philippines, facing the challenges of pacifying the region during the Philippine-American War.
title: Leonard Wood
name: Leonard Wood

description: Theresa Helburn is a prominent American playwright and theatrical producer, recognized for co-founding and producing the renowned Theatre Guild in New York City from 1919 to the 1950s.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1922 seems to capture the moment when Theresa Helburn, a rising force in the American theatre, had just married scholar John Baker Opdycke, a year after she solidified her place as a leading producer at the Theatre Guild, and a year before she presided over the groundbreaking ceremony for the new Guild Theatre.
title: Theresa Helburn
name: Theresa Helburn

description: Robert Francis Kennedy is a prominent figure in American history, serving as Attorney General and Senator. He is known for his advocacy for civil rights and his commitment to social justice. He was assassinated in 1968 while running for president.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1968 seems to capture the moment when Robert Kennedy, a man defined by his service to others, stood at a crossroads of national unrest. He was a crusader for civil rights, a champion of the poor, and a tireless advocate for peace. While he was running for president, his life was tragically cut short by an assassin's bullet.
title: Robert F. Kennedy
name: Robert Francis Kennedy

description: Jacob Jennings Brown is a prominent American military figure who rose to prominence during the War of 1812, achieving the rank of general and becoming a national hero for his victories on the northern border. He later served as the first Commanding General of the United States Army.

mainEvents.description: Wins at Chippawa and Lundy's Lane
Appointed Commanding General of the US Army

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1815 seems to capture the moment when Jacob Jennings Brown, having secured victories on the Niagara Frontier and established his reputation as a skilled commander during the War of 1812, stands on the precipice of a new chapter in his career, as he prepares to take on the challenges of leading the newly reorganized United States Army.
title: Jacob Jennings Brown
name: Jacob Jennings Brown

description: James Henry Hackett is a celebrated American actor known for his portrayal of eccentric characters and for managing the Italian opera singers that formed the nucleus of the Academy of Music in New York City.

mainEvents.description: James Henry Hackett married Catherine Leebuff
James Henry Hackett began acting career
James Henry Hackett first appeared in London's Covent Garden

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1832 seems to capture the moment when James Henry Hackett was at the peak of his theatrical fame, having established himself as a leading actor in both the United States and Britain, particularly for his interpretations of Shakespearean characters like Falstaff.
title: Mr. Hackett, in the Character of Rip Van Winkle
name: James Henry Hackett

description: Thomas Jefferson is a prominent Founding Father, the third president of the United States, and the primary author of the Declaration of Independence. He also drafted the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom and founded the University of Virginia.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1836 seems to capture the moment when Jefferson, having retired to Monticello, is reflecting on the accomplishments of his life, including the Declaration of Independence, the Louisiana Purchase, and the founding of the University of Virginia. This image suggests a quiet reflection on his role in shaping the nation's destiny.
title: Thomas Jefferson
name: Thomas Jefferson

description: Andrew Oliver is a prominent American-born merchant and colonial administrator who served as Lieutenant Governor of Massachusetts, best known for his role in the Stamp Act controversy. He was hanged in effigy for his support of the act, and his life was marked by political strife and public protests.

mainEvents.description: Oliver appointed Secretary of the Province of Massachusetts
Oliver is hanged in effigy in protest of the Stamp Act
Oliver was appointed Lieutenant Governor of Massachusetts

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1758 seems to capture the moment when Oliver, a seasoned merchant and politician, stands at the precipice of great political change. He is already a man of influence in Massachusetts, but the Stamp Act controversy is beginning to unfold, setting the stage for his eventual downfall.
title: Andrew Oliver
name: Andrew Oliver

description: William Gilmore Simms is a prolific Southern writer and politician who was a major force in antebellum Southern literature. He was known for his historical novels, strong pro-slavery views, and opposition to "Uncle Tom's Cabin."

mainEvents.description: Elected to the South Carolina House of Representatives

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in the 1860s seems to capture the moment when William Gilmore Simms, a man nearing the end of his career and the beginning of the Civil War, was a well-established and respected author in the South.
title: William Gilmore Simms
name: William Gilmore Simms

description: Andrew Jackson is a controversial historical figure, a war hero who served as the seventh President of the United States.  He is known for his strong personality, his expansion of democracy, and his brutal policies toward Native Americans.

mainEvents.description: Fought in the Battle of New Orleans
Elected as the seventh U.S. President

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1861 seems to capture the moment when Andrew Jackson was reflecting on his tumultuous legacy,  a time when his military victories and expansion of democracy were overshadowed by the devastating impact of his Indian Removal Act.
title: Andrew Jackson
name: Andrew Jackson

description: James Buchanan is a 15th president known for his states' rights stance, especially on slavery, and his presidency before the Civil War. His inaction during the secession crisis is criticized. He is the only lifelong bachelor to be U.S. president.

mainEvents.description: Elected president of the United States

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in September 28, 1859 seems to capture the moment when James Buchanan, despite being in his late sixties, was at the height of his political career, still holding the power of the presidency. This portrait captures a look of strength and ambition that would soon be tarnished by his actions during the secession crisis.
title: James Buchanan
name: James Buchanan

description: John Caldwell Calhoun is a prominent American statesman and political theorist who served as the seventh Vice President of the United States from 1825 to 1832. He is most remembered for his staunch defense of slavery, his concept of a 'concurrent majority' to protect minority rights, and his pivotal role in the Nullification Crisis of 1832, a pivotal event in the build-up to the American Civil War.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in c. 1832 seems to capture the moment when John Caldwell Calhoun, a rising star in the Democratic-Republican Party, was at the height of his national influence. His career as Secretary of War and his landslide victory in the 1824 Vice Presidential election had solidified his reputation as a nationalist, a reformer, and a champion of a strong federal government. He is seen here on the cusp of his radical transformation into a fierce advocate of states' rights and nullification, a shift motivated by his growing concern over the expansion of federal power and its threat to Southern interests.
title: John Caldwell Calhoun
name: John Caldwell Calhoun

description: Cyrus Hall McCormick is a prominent American inventor and businessman, known for his invention of the mechanical reaper, which revolutionized farming and contributed to the growth of the Midwest.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in mid 19th century seems to capture the moment when Cyrus McCormick, having built a successful company, was at the cusp of national recognition for his invention, the mechanical reaper, which would further revolutionize agriculture and shape the future of America's heartland.
title: Cyrus Hall McCormick
name: Cyrus Hall McCormick

description: John Tyler is a complex historical figure who served as the 10th President of the United States after William Henry Harrison's death. Known for his strong states' rights views, he clashed with the Whig Party, leading to his expulsion. He is also remembered for annexing Texas, which expanded U.S. territory but also fueled sectional tensions.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1842 seems to capture the moment when John Tyler, still grappling with the unexpected loss of his first wife, Letitia, was navigating the treacherous political landscape of his presidency. His stern expression might reflect the challenges he faced in balancing his states' rights convictions with the demands of the Whig Party, whose ambitions he thwarted with his forceful use of the veto power.
title: John Tyler
name: John Tyler

description: H. H. Richardson is a prominent American architect known for the "Richardsonian Romanesque" style, a heavy, picturesque, and influential design approach. He is considered one of the "trinity" of American architecture alongside Louis Sullivan and Frank Lloyd Wright.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1886 seems to capture the moment when Richardson, at the peak of his influence, was designing some of his most enduring and impactful works, including the Allegheny County Courthouse and the Marshall Field Wholesale Store.
title: H. H. Richardson
name: H. H. Richardson

description: Bp. George Berkeley is a renowned Anglo-Irish philosopher and bishop, best known for his theory of immaterialism, which argues that physical objects exist only as perceptions in the mind. He was a prolific writer, whose works tackled topics such as vision, motion, mathematics, and Christianity. Berkeley was also a key figure in the development of British empiricism and a defender of traditional Christianity against deism.

mainEvents.description: Published 'An Essay Towards a New Theory of Vision'
Published 'A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge'

portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1727? seems to capture the moment when Bp. Berkeley, having published several influential works, was at the height of his philosophical career,  but before he became Bishop of Cloyne and dedicated his life to theological works.

name: Bp. George Berkeley

description: Ulysses Simpson Grant is a pivotal figure in American history, renowned as a Civil War general who led the Union to victory and as the 18th president of the United States. He oversaw the Reconstruction era, attempted to implement a "Peace Policy" for Native Americans, and faced significant challenges in navigating a complex and rapidly changing nation.
portraitMoment: This portrait drawn in 1865 seems to capture the moment when Ulysses Simpson Grant stood on the precipice of a momentous change, having just achieved military victory, but with the immense challenges of Reconstruction and the future of the nation weighing heavily upon him.

name: Ulysses Simpson Grant

description: David Ramsay is a physician, public official, and historian best known for his writings on the American Revolution, notably "History of the American Revolution" and "History of South Carolina." description: Benjamin Henry Latrobe is a renowned Anglo-American architect known for introducing the Greek Revival style to the United States. description: Julius A. Fleischmann is a prominent American businessman, the long-time president of Fleischmann's Yeast, and a former mayor of Cincinnati known for his involvement in sports and philanthropy.

description: Martha Washington is a prominent figure in American history, known for her roles as wife of George Washington, First Lady of the United States, and symbol of the American Revolution. Served as the first Vice President
